dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START ON THE FACE of A GOLDEN CAT STATUE. This is the cat god BAST, lithe, noble, beautiful. CAMERA MOVES to reveal the statue is 50 feet tall, dominating this space. Other images of CATS -- hieroglyphics, ceramics -- abound, as d REAL CATS, hundreds of them, slinking in the shadows on r cut into the sandstone walls of this Egyptian temple. At Bast's feet, EIGHT ACOLYTES in GOWNS kneel in a semi- circle around a flaming BRAZIER. Some of the women WEEP, others PRAY or stare stoically ahead. From outside, we no hear DISTANT SCREAMS, the sounds of MARAUDERS. There's a RHYTHMIC BANGING at the massive BRONZE TEMPLE DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TEMPLE is an impressive place of worship -- tapered columns and an ornate Egyptian facade -- at the apex of a hilltop VILLAGE, in FLAMES, under ATTACK by a PERSIAN ARM

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: WHAM! THE STEEL PRONG of a mounted BATTERING RAM swings i the ornate DOORS of the temple. PERSIAN SOLDIERS operate brutal siege engine, SLAM the doors again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HIGH PRIESTESS wears a special HOODED WHITE GOWN that mostly conceals her face. She moves from one ACOLYTE to t next, pours a DARK LIQUID from a bejeweled decanter into golden goblets, then pours one for herself. She raises he goblet toward BAST, as do the others -- they drink in uni HIGH ANGLE as the GOBLETS CLATTER to the floor and the WO SLUMP to the ground... dead. PULL BACK -- we're watching this from the PERSPECTIVE of an EGYPTIAN MAU CAT -- slim, elegant, dark-spotted gray and black fur, a SCARAB MARK o its head. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MAU lets out a CRY... which prompts an eerie, growing CHORUS of MEOWS and HOWLS from the other CATS. THE CATS emerge from the hiding places en masse, leaping niches, converging on the bodies. The MAU leads the way, moves to the high priestess and puts its mouth to hers... ON THE TEMPLE DOORS - at last they BUCKLE and swing open. THE SOLDIERS, bearing TORCHES and SWORDS, storm inside. T grab anything of value, SMASH and DEFACE everything else. At the foot of BAST lie nine ROBES... but there's no sign the women who wore them. SOLDIERS slash the robes with th swords anyway, then snatch up the goblets for booty. An unearthly CRY -- half-human, half-feline -- from somew high above the rampaging soldiers. They freeze, looking around frantically. More EERIE CRIES echo off the walls, from all directions. The SOLDIERS raise their weapons, clustering defensively. From out of the shadows above the DARK HUMAN FORMS suddenly leap down with impossible agili STAY ON THE FACE OF BAST, peering down impassively. The torch-cast SHADOWS of the violence below play upon the statue's golden surface... FLAILING SWORDS, the swift SILHOUETTES of NAKED WOMEN. We hear the GUTTURAL CRIES of the soldiers, clearly outmatched in this mortal combat. MOVE TO THE CATS, perched above the fray, looking downwar they pace the temple's ledges and ramps excitedly. THE MA takes a final look at its handiwork, then leaps up, slink through a crevice at the roof, and emerges on -- cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: A ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: We hear the modern SOUNDS of passing AUTO TRAFFIC. CAMERA ROTATES to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MAU settles by a SATELLITE DISH, looking down on a present-day suburban street, a busy main drag. MARSHLAND WATER are visible not far away, light RAIN FALLS. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: The MAU watches as, ACROSS THE STREET, a BUS pulls away f the curb to reveal a WOMAN in a HOODED WHITE PONCHO -- the outfit recalls the high priestess of Bast. The HOOD is thrown back, revealing PATIENCE PRICE, 25-35, attractive but inclined to conceal her looks -- hair over face, baggy clothes under her poncho. She's cautious, eag to please, to do what's expected of her -- a bit of a doormat. Patience looks up from an address scribbled on a scrap of paper, and straight toward the cat on the roof -- almost if she'd sensed its presence. She smiles. THE MAU holds her gaze for a beat, then slinks out of sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eccentric, ramshackle home amongst neat, well-kept hou PATIENCE moves to the front door, RINGS. As she waits, sh notes the lawn GRASS grown high, CLIMBING CAT SCULPTURES the shingles. A SIGN by the door: "FELINE RESCUE SOCIETY. EDNA POWERS opens the door on a chain. She's 50-70, a for academic, intelligent, charming, but quite intimidating.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Hi, Edna Powers? (off her nod) I'm Patience Price, I called about adopting a cat? I saw your flyer at my vet's office --

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Oh yes, do come inside. EDNA undoes the chain, opens the door for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE, out of her poncho, fills out a questionnaire on clipboard. Numerous CATS roam the premises. Feline artwor and curios, scratching posts, furry toys... cat paradise. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: -+. Ma'am? EDNA is putting out DRY CAT FOOD in numerous BOWLS.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: You may call me Edna.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Edna. Some of these questions are... kind of personal. Do you really need to know how many, um, partners I've had in the past year?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in your love life. But I do want to know what sort of home environment you're offering, your degree of commitment...

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Guess I wouldn't need the cat if... Patience forces a laugh, fills in a ZERO and passes the clipboard to EDNA. The woman puts down the cat food, slip on the reading glasses she wears on a chain around her ne

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: The application is mostly a formality. I havea sense about people.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Well, I've always liked animals. (not enough) Cats specifically. I mean, I love them... worship them, even. EDNA seems satisfied, returns to reading Patience's answe THE MAU, meanwhile, comes around a corner into the room, peering curiously at Patience -- who dangles her hand invitingly. He rubs his face against her hand. PATIENCE smiles, coos at the cat -- which grabs her hand in his CLAWS. PATIENCE stifles a yelp, yanks her hand bac (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Son of a --

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Nothing... handsome cat. I've never seen one like him. THE MAU jumps into Patience's lap, settling in. Edna, surprised and almost suspicious, eyes the cat.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Her. That's Midnight, an Egyptian Mau. Normally she doesn't trust people -- EDNA reaches a hand toward MIDNIGHT -- the cat's fur stan up, she HISSES and SWIPES at Edna.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: See? Even I can't get near her... Very strange. (glancing at the application) So. You left out your parents' address.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Well... they're both dead.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: No hereditary illnesses, I hope.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Private plane crash. I was eleven. Actually, the last thing they gave me was a kitten... Fatso. EDNA sucks her breath in at this insulting name.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: He was very round -- not from overfeeding or anything, just -- really, he didn't mind. Anyway, he was with me a long time, till early this year. He didn't come at the sound of the can-opener, which kind of freaked me out... I found him just, curled up there in his little bed... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE is getting a bit emotional. EDNA reaches across squeezes her hand, with genuine sympathy. MIDNIGHT snuggl into Patience's lap, PURRING as she strokes the cat.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: It's very hard, dear, I know... you must be in so much pain. Midnight digs her long NAILS into Patience's thigh, knead PATIENCE winces, tries to dislodge cat's claws from her l -- Midnight "playfully" attacks her hand. Stifling a gasp

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Funny how cats get under our skin. They do exactly as they please, they don't care what anyone thinks about them... they're the ultimate predators. So self-contained, so independent, so wild... sometimes I wonder, why do they even put up with us?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: The free food?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: (putting the papers aside) Well, congratulations. It seems you've been chosen.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: So you think you might have a kitten for me...?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Kitten? No, that wouldn't be appropriate. Midnight has chosen you. PATIENCE looks a little unnerved at this. MIDNIGHT, rolli on her back, seems to be baring her fangs at Patience.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: It's a great honor. Maus are a very rare breed, descended from the sacred cats of ancient Egypt. They were believed to have magical gifts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIDNIGHT has wrapped herself around Patience's arm, kicki and biting "playfully."

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I'm not sure she likes me --

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Nonsense, she perceives something very special in you.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: There's nothing special about me.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Cats see things we don't. Our secret selves -- our souls.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Mm. Do you have any Band-Aids? cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES THROUGH this modest, neat studio apartment, a BULLETIN BOARD with numerous PHOTOS. One or two show a YOUNG PATIENCE, there's a picture of a LITTLE GIRL betwee TWO SMILING PARENTS on a ROLLER COASTER. Mostly, though, they're snapshots of a chubby TABBY CAT, from kitten hood old age. Suddenly, MIDNIGHT LUNGES INTO FRAME, attacking picture of FATSO, ripping it from the bulletin board. KEEP MOVING PAST WINDOWS facing on the street and an adja BUILDING across an alley -- it's a corner apartment on th second floor. CAMERA HOLDS ON A TV, where a classic OLD MOVIE like Now, Voyager plays. At a key, romantic moment,

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO COMMERCIAL --
dialogues.text: LAUREL AVENAL strides TOWARD CAMERA -- statuesque, perfec supermodel. We hear the VOICE of GEORGES AVENAL:

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You know who you are. You know what you're after. A MALE MODEL steps INTO FRAME, reaches for her --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You know you're too good for any man... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurel raises an eyebrow haughtily and SLAPS his face. Sh Moves past the male model to -- -- GEORGES AVENAL. He's Laurel's husband and the company C.E.O., handsome and charismatic. LAUREL falls into his arms. He caresses her, deeply in love. Georges WINKS.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: --. almost. CUT TO a PRODUCT SHOT of a JAR OF CREAM, the name "BEAUNI and the AVENAL LOGO.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Beaunique by Avenal. You know you want it. CLOSE ON LAUREL as she tosses her hair back, Gilda-style, with a seductive pout. She purses her lips in a kiss. REVERSE ANGLE -- PATIENCE watches with a curled lip, on t couch in a T-shirt and shorts, EATING CHOCOLATE ICE CREAM directly from a pint carton, a dark smear around her mout Suddenly, MIDNIGHT POUNCES at the SPOON OF ICE CREAM. Patience jerks back, startled, raises the spoon out of re

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: No -- this is mine! MIDNIGHT doesn't back off, jumping repeatedly at the spoo climbing over Patience, getting a rear PAW in the open pi

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh, gross, you -- just take it. Patience offers the cat the half-empty pint. As MIDNIGHT digs in happily, burying his head in the container -- LIGHTS COME ON in the apartment across the way. PATIENCE hesitates only an instant, sticks the spoon in h mouth, CLICKS OFF the TV and flips off a LAMP by the sofa THROUGH THE WINDOW, A HANDSOME MAN -- his name is TOM LON crosses past. PATIENCE sighs in the dark, moving for a better view. Thi voyeurism is a guilty habit. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONE checks his mail, loosens his tie, unbuttons his shir

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Welcome home, sweetie. How was work today...? (male voice) Same old same old. All I wanna do is get out of this shirt and give you a big old hug... LONE is distracted, reading his mail, shirt still on. MIDNIGHT, meanwhile, pulls her head out of the ice cream leaps onto the windowsill -- she looks first at Lone, the Patience, who looks around her.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Down in front... Come on, you, off with the shirt. Instead, LONE is moving out of view. PATIENCE moves in th same direction, into her BATHROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BATHROOM WINDOW faces into Lone's bedroom. He starts unbutton his shirt, glances casually out the window -- PATIENCE immediately ducks out of sight. A moment later, rises slowly to peek out again -- THE WINDOW is DARK, LONE has turned off THE LIGHT. PATIENCE flips ON THE LIGHT, studies her face in the mirr

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Lame, lame, lame. She wipes a bit of chocolate from the corner of her mouth She tries a seductive pout, a la Laurel, gives her hair a seductive toss -- it winds up in her eyes and mouth. ON PATIENCE'S WINDOW -- from across the alley, we see PATIENCE before her mirror, brushing her hair. PULL BACK reveal we're watching with TOM LONE, who spies on Patienc through his own window, lights off. He SIGHS. cut TO:  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING CAMERA delivers an assault on the senses: MIRRORS, oversized versions of the BEAUTY PRODUCTS, charts of COLO CHOICES, shelves upon shelves of slickly-packaged COSMETI Prominent is a DISPLAY for BEAUNIQUE. HIP MUSIC in BG. AVENAL GIRLS, perfectly coiffed and made-up Barbie dolls, busily paint the faces of CLIENTS, women of all ages and backgrounds, in high-tech MAKE-UP CHAIRS that resemble torture devices. PATIENCE crosses through, pausing to take off her sneaker and pull on a pair of high heels. SALLY -- an Avenal girl in a prim outfit, working on a matronly CUSTOMER -- looks up to greet PATIENCE. We now see Patience has a small SCRATCH on her cheek, poorly covered with makeup.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Look what the cat dragged in.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (touching her cheek) I know, I know, I'm late -- Midnight thought there was a mouse in my pillow.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: This is why I only sleep with my own species. Lunch at Joey's? PATIENCE nods and waves as she hurries through a set of d to an ELEVATOR BANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD ANGLE on a rat's maze of office cubicles, people with ACCOUNTING STAFF. FIND PATIENCE tapping at her terminal, sipping COFFEE. It's a grim little space, enlivened by a GARFIELD toy, some New Yorker cartoons. PATIENCE seems bored by the drone work -- then she cocks head at something on the screen, leans closer. She double checks DATA in the print-outs. Something doesn't tally. ON SCREEN -- among a long list of figures, we see "YP-3" highlighted, followed by a series of numbers. PATIENCE gets up quickly with the printouts, she spills a drops of COFFEE on her white blouse. She dabs at these distractedly as she moves through the bullpen toward a glassed-in office. She knocks on the open door, where we the name "D. BERGER - ACCOUNTING." (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Dave, I was just going over the first quarter expenses. Our lab fees for this one additive -- YP-3 -- have gone through the roof. BERGER, a balding, bespectacled accountant, looks up as Patience moves around his desk to show him some figures.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Look at this, an overage of eight hundred percent on "extruded pellets" alone -- I'm not even sure what that is --

dialogues.speaker: BERGER
dialogues.text: Rat chow. Berger's concerned. As they huddle over the figures, we h a CHOPPER approach. CAMERA MOVES PAST THEM, OUT the WINDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CAMERA SWINGS UP the 40-story skyscraper in the busine district of a city mixing architecture old and new. CAMER PASSES a WINDOW WASHER on a cable-driven rig. NEARING the ROOF, we see a glowing sign which reads "AVENAL BEAUTY" - and a PASSENGER CHOPPER coming in for a landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CHOPPER touches down on a HELIPAD atop an elevated PENTHOUSE. GEORGES AVENAL emerges, ducking in the blade wash. The company's CEO, Georges is charismatic, handsome immaculately tailored -- an exacting asshole to the core. Getting out of the helicopter behind him, his menacing, silent bodyguard ANGEL carries a leather suitcase or two. LAUREL AVENAL trots toward her husband with open arms. Laurel is 30-something, a still-gorgeous super-model but, person, a tad past her prime. She comes across as sweet a well-meaning, but a bit dim and victimized.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Oh honey, welcome back! She throws her arms around Georges to give him a kiss, bu pushes her away, turns aside to SNEEZE. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: My allergies. I thought you were getting rid of that vile dog of yours. GEORGES plucks a long DOG HAIR from her clothes, holds it for her to see, then moves on briskly, down an external flight of stairs from the helipad to a PENTHOUSE below. Laurel follows after him, Angel in the rear.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Georges, when you're gone, Tippy is all I've got and -- I get so lonely.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: So get a bird or a fish, something that doesn't shed. (a glance at her) Have you gained weight? They head through glass doors into the PENTHOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL protests, examining her body.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: No no, it's muscle -- I've been working out, doing my Tae Kwan Do -- She flexes a MUSCLE to demonstrate. GEORGES isn't interested, looking at the penthouse decor with distaste. Meanwhile ANGEL moves to an elevator, presses a down butt and awaits his masters. The penthouse is a large, dramatic space, decorated in a frilly, Louis XIV style -- classical STATUARY of nude females, ornate DRAPERIES across one wall -- there are LADDERS, cans of paint, a work in progress. A large PORTR of LAUREL dominates the room. In one alcove is a MOVIE-ST MAKE-UP MIRROR, surrounded by lights.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: What the hell happened here? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I'm doing some redecorating, I've had so much time on my hands -- do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: No. What's with the curtains?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Draperies. They soften the space...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: I like hard spaces. (off her hurt look) Whatever, Laurel, if it makes you happy. I plan to be spending more time at the factory, anyway. He enters the ELEVATOR, Laurel behind, Angel hits the but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE GRAPHIC depicts LAUREL and GEORGE together. PATIE curls her lip at this as she presses the DOWN button. DOORS OPEN to reveal the real LAUREL and GEORGES, startli Patience a bit, the impassive ANGEL behind them. Patience takes a half-step forward and hesitates, reluctant to get aboard, frozen in place. The DOORS start to close, then o again -- she's in the way.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: In or out? PATIENCE meekly steps into the elevator, presses a button the lobby, nervously keeping her eyes fixed to the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGES leans past her to hit "DOOR CLOSE." Many CAT HAIR are sprinkled on her clothes, he SNIFFS and stifles a sne He looks Patience over, and doesn't like what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Excuse me, miss. Do you know who I am? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Um... of course. You're Georges Avenal -- you own the company --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Then you actually work for me. Are you familiar with our products?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Yes sir, I just can't really afford them --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: You can afford some peroxide, can't you? Do something about this mousy hair. GEORGES runs a hand distastefully through her frizzy hair then takes a moment to study her.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Stain on your blouse, run in your pantyhose -- and that color's awful on you. (fingering her outfit) Do you own an iron? Show me your hands. Shaking, Patience extends her hands. Georges inspects her trembling fingers. He seems saddened, clucks his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: A nail-biter... my my, you really are the "before" picture, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I could give her the number for my manicurist --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: (waving Laurel off) What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Patience...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: I haven't got all day -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: No, my name's Patience, Patience Price. I'm in accounting.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that's no excuse. Regardless of your position, you do represent Avenal Beauty. I simply can't allow that to continue.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Wait. You're not -- firing me?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: I have no choice. All we have to sell is an image -- and you are not it. You've got to go. DING! The DOOR OPENS. Patience stares at the man in disbelief, then bolts out into the SHOWROOM. STAY WITH GEORGES, LAUREL and ANGEL as the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Poor girl. GEORGES studies Laurel's face a moment, leans closer, ama

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Is that a pimple?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A retro place, PATIENCE and SALLY sit in a booth over SAL and SODAS. Sally leans across the table, fixing Patience' make-up -- her mascara's run from crying, her nose is red An open MAKE-UP POUCH rests between them.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I try, Sally, I really do. I read Vogue, I wear uncomfortable shoes... I've been a female all my life, you'd think I'd be better at it by now.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Watch the frown lines, you'll need a lift before you're forty. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens 16.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: He's right, I'm not even presentable enough to be an accountant. Maybe the church needs a new bell- ringer.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Look, he was just in a bad mood. Sales are down, his marriage is on the rocks --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I have an enquiring mind. This is "Nympho," very hot, I snagged it from the showroom... a tube of LIPSTICK, starts applying it expertly to Patience's lips as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Laurel's losing her looks, she's dumber than her cockapoo buzz is, Georges is trading her in for next year's model. All I'm saying is, by now he's probably forgotten about canning you.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I don't care. No way am I going back there.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Shut up, you'll smear... voila, now suck your finger. Patience puts her finger in her mouth, pulls it out with pop, to keep the lipstick off her teeth. She studies the residue on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I can't believe we put this stuff on our mouths. Grease, acid and ground-up fish scales... who knows what they put in our mascara...

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: No wonder you never made it in sales. ANGLE THROUGH WINDOW BEHIND THEM, as a long LIMOUSINE pas  17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL is fixing her make-up meticulously in a COMPACT MIRROR, looking for signs of the dreaded zit. GEORGES is flipping through AD LAYOUT BOARDS. WESLEY, a weasely ASSISTANT, is seated between them, going over an electron appointment book. A CHAUFFEUR, ANGEL in the passenger sea

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: You're both scheduled to appear at the Make-Overs for the Homeless event on the 25th --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Ugh. That one's yours, Laurel.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: The ballet opens the following Friday --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: (re: the ad boards) These look good, Wesley, send them back to the agency. LAUREL closes the compact, leans across to catch a glimps

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: May I see?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: You wouldn't be interested.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Please, Georges? She tugs a board away, then sucks in her breath seeing -- AN AD featuring DRINA, a gorgeous young model, nearly nud We see a tube of MASCARA with the AVENAL LOGO.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: That's Drina.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: She's... pretty.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: She's magnificent. GEORGES takes the board back, LAUREL looks a little sick. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Well, I'm still the face of Avenal... aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: (smiling indulgently) You've had a remarkably long shelf life, it's true. But... every product has an expiration date. Laurel bites her lip, looks out the window, close to tear A PHONE is ringing, ANGEL answers in front. Georges' hand are still full with the ads piled around him.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Uh, sir, it's Dave Berger in accounting.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Who? I don't talk to bean-counters.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: He says it's urgent.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: All right, Angel, put it on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERGER peers at his TERMINAL, a half-eaten SANDWICH nearb He's marked up the PRINT-OUTS that Patience brought him.

dialogues.speaker: BERGER
dialogues.text: (on phone) Mr. Avenal -- I hate to bother you, sir, but we have a problem. It seems the lab has been overproducing YP-3 -- that's the anti-aging ingredient in Beaunique --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this? It's routine to have a surplus -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: BERGER
dialogues.text: We've stockpiled over a thousand gallons, enough to last us well into the 29th Century.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Perhaps that is a trifle optimistic --

dialogues.speaker: BERGER
dialogues.text: And very expensive. Funding seems to have been siphoned out of the employee pension plan --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Impossible, this has to be an error. Are you responsible for this data?

dialogues.speaker: BERGER
dialogues.text: Well, actually Patience Price brought the matter to my attention --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, I'm familiar with Ms. Price. Obviously her bookkeeping is as sloppy as her appearance.

dialogues.speaker: BERGER
dialogues.text: Sir, she's a very reliable employee --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: I've heard enough, Berger. In the future, double- check your figures before you waste my time -- and then put it in a memo.

dialogues.speaker: BERGER
dialogues.text: (on phone) In all fairness, Mr. Avenal, I think -- BEEP. He's talking to a dial tone. Berger hangs up, frustrated and chagrined. cut TO:  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START on a JEWELRY DISPLAY, a ritzy DIAMOND NECKLACE. SALLY's face appears in the window, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Wow... sorry, Patience, I just found a new best friend. PATIENCE, beside her, WHISTLES appreciatively, then moves

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I'm sick of drooling over things I'll never have. The two are WINDOW-SHOPPING, passing a SHOE STORE, boots and high-heels... A WESTERNWEAR SHOP, belt buckles, WHIPS

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Oh, you're a ray of sunshine. Tell you what, let me take you clubbing this weekend --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I'm fit to be seen in public.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You will be in that dress. I've had my eye on it for weeks. SALLY points at a MANNEQUIN in the window of a trendy boutique, garbed in a dramatic, sexy outfit -- a short bodice, a tiny skirt, plenty of plastic skin showing.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Sally, that is not a dress, it's a rumor of a dress. It's barely forensic evidence of a dress.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: It's a genuine Gaultier knock-off --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: It's not me.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: But don't you ever wanna be somebody else?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I just wish I could be ten years old again -- it didn't matter what I wore as long as I could climb a tree in it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Your tomboy days are over.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: That's my bus, Sal, see you later. PATIENCE trots toward a BUS, SALLY calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: This weekend, Patience. I swear, I'm gonna make you have fun if it kills you... As Sally moves on, CAMERA LINGERS ON the window of A LING STORE, scantily-clad MANNEQUINS, including one in BLACK UNDIES and a CAT MASK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE BERGER, the accountant, dressed casually, gets out o CAB and heads into his modest home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berger SNIFFS the air quizzically as he lets himself in. He moves toward the KITCHEN. In the kitchen DOORWAY, he fumbles for a LIGHT SWITCH, flicks it on and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BOOM! The WINDOWS BLOW OUT with a HUGE EXPLOSION. ACROSS THE STREET, a BLACK MERCEDES pulls from the curb, HEADLIGHTS OFF, and ACCELERATES away. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE moves to her apartment door, arms loaded with GROCERIES. She struggles to unlock the door while keeping these upright -- we see a "HELLO KITTY" emblem on her key chain. As soon as the door is open -- -- MIDNIGHT BOLTS out into the hall, a black streak movin toward the stairs and darting upward. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Midnight! You little monster -- Patience tosses her groceries in the door, leaving it aja and runs after the cat. A few moments after she's vanished up the stairs, we hear FOOTSTEPS from below and... ANGEL, Georges Avenal's menacing bodyguard, appears in th hallway. He moves purposefully for Patience's door, pushe it open and steps inside. Midnight just saved her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIDNIGHT makes for an open hall window that leads onto a ESCAPE. Patience just spots her heading outside.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience reaches the window just in time to see -- MIDNIGHT make a SPECTACULAR LEAP across the alleyway and -- -- LAND ON TOM LONE'S BALCONY. PATIENCE is annoyed, but also impressed, in spite of hers

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Hell of a jump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL flings open the closet and bathroom doors in Patien empty apartment -- no dice. On his way out, he eyes a pla of cat food and ice cream with a wince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience clumsily CLAMBERS up Lone's RATTLING FIRE ESCAPE reaches the level Midnight is on, moves toward the cat. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: You are not worth the trouble -- Suddenly, a WINDOW FLIES OPEN, just a foot away, a GUN po in her face. Patience lets out a CRY, jumps back --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Freeze! It's TOM LONE. But Patience loses her balance, FALLS -- -- and LANDS in an open DUMPSTER. LONE darts from the window, alarmed, realizing his error.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGEL emerges, shaking his head and shrugging toward the unseen driver of the BLACK MERCEDES, then he climbs in th passenger door. As the car pulls away -- -- LONE hurries from the building next-door toward the al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE painfully gets upright, slipping in the trash, a LONE appears; he's a no-nonsense, gruff cop with a dry wi

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: You all right? He clambers onto the dumpster's edge to help her out, she slips and slides, almost pulls him in after her.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry -- I'm a police officer, I heard the noise and just assumed... here, grab my arm. He manages to hoist Patience to the lip, she's able to cl to the ground. She's drenched in GOOEY GARBAGE, just star at Lone, a bit dazed from the fall. She can't believe she face to face with the man of her dreams. Lone thinks a be

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Habla espanol? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She blinks at him, confused, then he tentatively flashes few HAND SIGNS for the deaf. She waves this off.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: No, I -- see, my cat got out -- MIDNIGHT MEWS, rubs against Patience's leg. She picks the cat up, nods toward her window.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I live right up there --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I mean, I -- I've seen you. Around.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Really. Actually, I've seen you too. Around, that is. (a nod at the dumpster) Thanks for helping me out.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Don't mention it. I can't resist a damsel in distress. PATIENCE smiles and cocks her head... flirtatious body language. She runs a hand through her hair, pulls out som sticky TISSUE PAPER, looks at it with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh God, what -- what is that?! He looks over her shoulder, winces.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I could run it over to the lab... She tosses it in the dumpster, finally registering that s drenched in WET GARBAGE.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it was nice talking to you, but -- I'm completely disgusting. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mortified, she hurries back to the entrance to her buildi Lone looks after her, amused. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOTLIGHTS before a NIGHTCLUB, a CROWD behind a VELVET RO A HANDSOME BOUNCER stands guard. SALLY AND PATIENCE are n the front of the line. Sally has transformed herself, wit heavy make-up, a revealing skin-tight outfit that shows plenty of cleavage. Patience is in a conservative dress, she might wear to work. Sally HOWLS with LAUGHTER at something Patience has just said. Patience looks grim.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: It isn't funny.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (still chuckling) Yes it is. All this time you've spent mooning over that hottie neighbor and he points a gun at you --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: At least it broke the ice --

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I told you men go for trashy women. Patience rolls her eyes, looks over Sally's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Speaking of which -- how do you even stay in that outfit?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: With any luck, I won't need to.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I hardly recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: That's the idea. I go out at night, I leave daytime Sally behind, become a different person. All women do. Except you, of course. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (shrugs, checks her watch) How long have we been here, an hour? We're never getting in... A TRENDY COUPLE -- call them RANDY and SANDY -- push thei way past PATIENCE, almost knocking her over. Randy's ELBO gets her in the gut, Sandy's SPIKE HEEL drives into her f

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: ow! SANDY looks at her blankly as PATIENCE hops, injured.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: You could say I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Okay, you're sorry. He and Sandy laugh as the BOUNCER unhooks the rope, steps aside for them to enter.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: God, people are so rude.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Yes! Sally has just gotten the NOD, hurries forward. Patience follows, limping a bit. The BOUNCER blocks Patience's pat looking her over from head to toe, disapproving.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: She's with me.

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: Then you can stay out here too.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: She happens to be a very fine human being --

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: Like I said, she don't belong inside.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Sally, just -- go in without me --

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: See, you shoulda bought the dress. PATIENCE bolts, humiliated; SALLY looks after her sadly.  27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE sits alone in the back of the bus, looks at -- A YOUNG COUPLE making out... an ELDERLY COUPLE holding ha Her eyes drift to an AD for AVENAL BEAUTY overhead -- LAU and GEORGES AVENAL, arms around each other. Patience sigh and stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE walks toward her building, the bus kiosk behind the BUS MOVING AWAY. The street is deserted at this hour. Patience feels very alone, until she looks up to see -- -- MIDNIGHT, perched in her window, awaiting her arrival. A smile appears on Patience's face. She quickens her step crossing the empty street, almost to the sidewalk when -- -- AN ENGINE ROARS behind her. Patience spins just as -- -- THE MERCEDES, LIGHTS OFF, barrels out of the darkness WHAM! Hits her full-on. MIDNIGHT at the WINDOW -- the cat lets out a HOWL. ANGLE DOWN, the MERCEDES has stopped, Patience lies a sho distance behind... in bad shape. The PASSENGER DOOR OPENS WITH PATIENCE, barely conscious. ANGEL approaches, studie her, turns her over with his foot. He nods, a job well do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIDNIGHT is bouncing off the walls, HOWLING like mad, lun and scratching at the door. Finally, the cat charges acro the floor, LAUNCHES herself in a dramatic leap and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION as MIDNIGHT LAUNCHES HERSELF AT THE GLASS --

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: cut TO:  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLASH! A BODY (we don't get a good look) hits DARK WATER hard and vanishes below. MOVE UP TO REVEAL we're at a bri over a river, CITY LIGHTS in the distance. ON THE ROADWAY CAR DOORS CLOSE and the MERCEDES SEDAN SCREECHES away. CLOSER ON THE SKYLINE. A HOWL rises -- FIND MIDNIGHT, CRY from a rooftop. Unseen CATS join in, a feline TELEGRAPH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAT CRY, just audible, far off. Then -- a CAT squeeze out a WINDOW at the gap in the sill... more CATS SCRAMBLE dormers... yet MORE SHOOT OUT the flapping CAT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDNA'S CATS scramble through alleyways, joined by STRAYS converging from all directions, picking up the CHORUS. It like a flowing RIVER OF CATS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MURKY MOONLIT WATER -- CAMERA MOVES past floating TRAS CAR TIRE, BOTTLES and CANS. We hear the CRIES of the CATS from nearby, approaching. LIGHTS of the CITY further away the BRIDGE visible. CAMERA FINDS a nylon-encased FOOT... PAN OVER a woman's CORPSE, her clothes TORN, SOAKED and MUDDY, strewn with R WEEDS. The body bobs amidst REEDS by this soggy shoreline We reach the woman's FACE -- unnaturally pale, eyes fixed it's PATIENCE PRICE. Dead. THE HOWLING is CLOSE now... THE CATS have gathered here, parting for MIDNIGHT, a feline VIP. The Mau steps tentatively out onto Patience's corpse, careful not to ge too wet. She crouches on her chest, and -- CLOSE, BREATHES audibly into her parted lips. A brief, barely visible GLOW flickers at Patience's mouth. THE CAT shudders, then moves aside, BLINKS as if drugged. ANOTHER CAT climbs out onto Patience to take Midnight's p and perform the same ritual. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE. The crowd of CATS waiting in the reeds, more arriving by the minute, ready to take turns. CAMERA ROCKETS DOWN AT PATIENCE'S FACE, into one DEAD EYE

dialogues.speaker: DARK, DISTORTED
dialogues.text: perhaps CAT POVS (LOW-ANGLE TRACKING and CLIMBING SHOTS) mixed with human MEMORIES: POV, a ROLLER-COASTER, PATIENCE'S PARENTS to either side we hear YOUNG PATIENCE'S LAUGHTER and SHRIEKS. CLOSE TO GROUND, FATSO the KITTEN dashes after a BELL BAL POV, YOUNG PATIENCE at a mirror in a Halloween CAT COSTUM POV, CLIMBING A TREE in a suburban backyard. We see her M below, searching for young Patience. POV, TWO CLOSED COFFINS, surrounded by FLOWERS... now we YOUNG PATIENCE SOBBING. POV, the BLACK MERCEDES ROCKETS AT CAMERA and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- PATIENCE sits up INTO FRAME with a SCREAM. She thrashes in the shallows of the marsh, gasping for ai disoriented... reborn. There's no sign of the cats. PATIENCE crawls onto shore amidst the reeds, slightly clu at first, almost like a newborn kitten. Her ragged, wet clothes cling to her body. TIGHT on her terrified expression. She has no idea what she's doing here -- or who, or what she is. She opens her mouth to speak -- all that comes out is a strangled CAT C She works her jaw, but can't produce human speech. She da her head, seems disoriented and overwhelmed. HER POV -- SOUNDS AMPLIFIED, IMAGE perhaps SOLARIZED, the darkness BRIGHTENED, objects of interest HIGHLIGHTED as s takes in the marshland. The EYES of any creature in sight GLOW. We'll call this CATVISION. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WHIP PAN TO a nearby CRICKET perched on a blade of grass then UP TO an OWL in the distance, soaring over the park. WHIP DOWN TO its prey, a SCURRYING MOUSE. THE OWL swoops with a SCREECH, nailing the MOUSE, we hear its SQUEAL. PATIENCE, frightened at first, becomes increasingly delig by her heightened senses. She spots -- MIDNIGHT in the tall grass. The cat turns, looks over her shoulder once -- her EYES catch moonlight and GLOW. Patie is clearly meant to follow. PATIENCE follows MIDNIGHT on all fours, tenuously at firs But as she proceeds, her shoulders and hips roll in distinctly feline fashion. Her body seems slimmer, more muscular. She rises on two legs, moving in a slinky crouc MIDNIGHT pauses to sharpen her claws on the bark of a gna old TREE. PATIENCE follows Midnight's lead, leans forward against the trunk, arms straight out, head arched back. S stretches her neck, her back -- her every movement is graceful, sensual, the awkwardness gone. She tries to pull her hands from the tree -- but can't fo moment, finding her FINGER-NAILS stuck into the bark (lik cat at a scratching post). A DOG BARKS -- without thinking about it, PATIENCE scramb up the side of the tree like a streak. HER POV FROM TREE -- A LARGE DOG tugs on its OWNER'S leas some distance away. The dog walker yanks the dog onward. PATIENCE takes this in, hears a MEOW -- MIDNIGHT is perched above her, very Cheshire Cat-like. PATIENCE looks around, self-conscious for a moment -- wha she doing up a tree? Bad idea to think. She loses her balance, clutching at branches, tumbles out of the tree - IN MIDAIR for an instant, she flails spastically, letting a SHRIEK -- then her body instinctively TWISTS and -- PATIENCE LANDS on all fours, one leg kicked out, haunches low. MIDNIGHT lands beside her, nods approvingly at her landing. Then the cat darts away again, Patience pursues.  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIDNIGHT leaps to the top of a FENCE, staring down at Patience -- "come on." Patience hesitates, then crouches SPRINGS UP (with more than human ability), lands triumpha on the fence -- then teeters and TUMBLES to the other sid MIDNIGHT looks disappointed. Patience jumps up again quickly, as if pretending this never happened, this time managing to hold her balance. MIDNIGHT gives her a look and leads onward. At first she' like a tightrope walker, careful of falling, but her step become more confident. Soon she's moving as quickly and smoothly as the cat. MIDNIGHT leaps off the fence and darts across a road, PATIENCE follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall wrought-iron FENCE surrounds greenery and distant cages in an urban area. A SIGN: "ARBORETUM - ZOO." MIDNIGHT squeezes through a gap between the uprights. PATIENCE hesitates -- this is too narrow for a normal hum MIDNIGHT waits impatiently on the other side, tail twitch PATIENCE makes a dubious SOUND, but manages to slip a foo then a leg -- into the opening, twisting and contorting. Amazingly, she's succeeding, her torso ripples and contra as she insinuates herself between the bars. Finally only head is on the wrong side. With a final TUG, she's throug MIDNIGHT crouches low, stalking. PATIENCE copies the behavior. MIDNIGHT slowly approaches -- A MOTH, fluttering near a FLOWER in this botanical garden MIDNIGHT sneaks up close, then POUNCES, but the MOTH flie out of the cat's grasp. PATIENCE GIGGLES, MIDNIGHT turns on her and HISSES. The woman and the cat roll together in this neat BOTANICAL GARDEN, playing and batting at each other. CAMERA MOVES T small sign nearby, which labels this planting as "CATNIP. MIDNIGHT HURTLES a CONCRETE MOAT, PATIENCE follows, still high, giggly. She suddenly finds herself face to face wit A BENGAL TIGER. He lets out a small ROAR. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PATIENCE blinks, crouches -- and ROARS back, unafraid. Th tiger springs forward... and LICKS HER. She wrestles with him playfully, he's just a bigger version of Midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDNA POWERS sleeps in bed. MIDNIGHT climbs atop her, star kneading. She makes a NOISE, rolls over, opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Midnight? What are you doing here? She squints, sees morning light through a window. She cli out of bed in her nightdress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDNA emerges in a bathrobe, crossing her overgrown lawn, MIDNIGHT bounding ahead of her. A Martha Stewarty NEIGHBO weeding an immaculate garden, throws Edna a sour look.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: Edna, your cats have been using my garden as a litter box again.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: (gravely) You can't change their nature. The neighbor scowls and returns to her weeding. As EDNA bends down for her newspaper, she hears a MEOW and sees -- -- Midnight licking a HAND, which protrudes from under a bush. Edna GASPS, moves closer, crouching to get a better look. It's PATIENCE, sound asleep, body twisted sideways in an unnatural position. Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Hello...? Patience starts awake, looking around, confused. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: What are you doing in my hedge? Patience rolls out from under the bushes, crouches on her haunches now, a panicky look in her eyes. Leaves and dirt cling to her clothes. She has no idea how she got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE is wrapped in a BLANKET, sitting on the couch, MIDNIGHT nuzzling her, as EDNA brings her a cup of TEA. E picks up a CLIPBOARD from a coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Your name is Patience Price, you live on South 87th. (beat) You love chocolate -- you're afraid of heights? Any of this ring a bell? Patience nods slowly, puts her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I... it's coming back to me. But last night... it's just... it's like a dream.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: (chiding) You said in your application that you don't drink or take drugs.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (rising) I don't. I think... something must have happened. I need to...

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: You need to rest. Patience takes a few steps from the couch and lets the blanket slip from her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Oh my God... Edna stares at PATIENCE'S BACK. The fabric of her dress i torn, the skin discolored beneath with a hint of dried bl -- and we make out the marks left by a TIRE TREAD. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: You're in no condition to -- EDNA moves beside Patience and GRABS HER by the wrist -- ON PATIENCE'S HAND, the fingers CURL and FIVE SHARP CAT C (SPFX) emerge from her fingertips -- only for an instant. EDNA blinks at this, PATIENCE whirls on her with an abrup and frightening HISS -- CLOSE, Patience's pupils become ELLIPTICAL for a blink, flecked with GOLD, then -- She yanks her hand away quickly, immediately looks contri and a bit dazed from the momentary transformation.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Sorry, you -- you startled me... look, Edna, thanks for everything, but -- I just want to get home and take a bath. Edna nods, unnerved. PATIENCE picks MIDNIGHT up in her ar and hurries out the door. Edna stares after her, a disturbing thought forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDNA moves purposefully to a FILE CABINET in this clutter book-lined room and opens a drawer. She thumbs past many years' worth of scholarly research, finally pulling a thi dog-eared MANILA FILE from near the back. She moves to he desk, slips on reading glasses and opens the folder -- ANGLE ON FILE -- an old, thick type-written SCHOLARLY PAP entitled "MYTHS OF FELIGYNY, by E. POWERS Ph.D." She puts this aside, revealing a WOODCUT of an AFRICAN Catwoman in leopard skin, surrounded by cats. Next, an ASIAN CATWOMAN print of a 19th Century watercolor. She wears a Chinese- style MASK, close-fitting robes, a long tail. Both illustrations show the women with CLAWS and ELLIPTICAL PUPILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE stares at her dirty face in the MIRROR, still reeling from the events of the previous night. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Behind her, THE BATHTUB RUNS, almost filled. She moves to the edge of the tub, starting to undo her ragged clothes, stares down at -- THE RIPPLING WATER. She blinks, her expression far away --

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A vertiginous PLUNGE from the bridge toward DARK WATER --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE starts, shaking off this momentary vision. She dips a finger in the water, jerks back -- much as a c might. She shakes drops off her hand, repelled by the wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's KNOCKING at the door. The PHONE IS RINGING, a MACHINE picks up. We hear RUNNING WATER from beyond the closed bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Patience, you can leave a message if you want... BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE turns off the TAPS, in the quiet she hears EDNA' VOICE on her answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's Edna Powers -- the most extraordinary thing, I -- I think I know what's happened to you -- PATIENCE has risen with a shiver, hurries back into the m room, pulling her blouse closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE moves for the PHONE, but FREEZES at the sight of -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- THE DOORKNOB RATTLING, someone trying to get in.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- be careful, Patience, I'm afraid you may be in danger... MIDNIGHT lets out a menacing GROWL. THE KNOB TURNS, the door swings open -- a MAN starts to e CLANG! PATIENCE whacks him over the head with a FRYING PA THE MAN is knocked hard into the door and slumps to the ground, stunned... it's TOM LONE. PATIENCE recognizes him with horror, looks at the door -- PATIENCE'S KEYS with the "HELLO KITTY" emblem dangle from lock, her PURSE is on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I am so, so sorry -- TOM LONE groans, painfully coming to and sitting up. PATIENCE crouches at his side.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: You actually hit me with a frying pan?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I didn't know it was you.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Guess we're even now. Name's Tom Lone, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (shakes his hand) Patience Price.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, I checked your ID.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh God, not that awful driver's license picture --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: (rubbing his head) Got any ice? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PATIENCE hurries to assemble an ice pack, MIDNIGHT is eat happily at the table, LONE gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I found your purse in the street right outside this morning. I tried calling -- I was afraid something might've happened to you... PATIENCE returns with a washcloth full of ice.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: That was really nice of you.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Well, it's part of my job... I'm a detective, burglary-robbery division. So what did happen to you? He applies the ice-pack to his head while eying her cloth She suddenly becomes aware of her disheveled appearance.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh no, I'm amess. It seems every time you see me I -- I was just cleaning. (this isn't flying) The um, the chimney.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Where's the fireplace?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: It wasn't mine.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: You're a freelance chimney sweep? LONE is now looking around the apartment, taking it all i with a careful detective's eye. He sees the shredded PHOTOGRAPHS, the BROKEN WINDOW, points --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: You should get that fixed.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I hadn't noticed... I mean, I had to break it to get in because... I lost my purse. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: (studying the windowsill) Funny, looks like it was broken from inside. Lone is now regarding her with open curiosity. Patience shrugs helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: So everything's all right now? (off her nod) Well, I'd better be getting to the station, then... unless there's anything else. LONE hopes so, PATIENCE desperately wants him to stay...

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I guess not...

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Then -- bye, now. He sounds disappointed. As the door shuts, Patience clutc her hair, makes a SOUND of frustration, almost like a MEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE flings open the door, calls after Lone:

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I want you... He turns, startled. Patience has a sultry, come-hither lo in her eye, her VOICE has a lower, sexier tone.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Excuse me? She shudders. The sexy expression turns to one of shock a anxiety -- what has she done? Then, vamping:

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I want you, um, to forgive me. For hitting you like that.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: No need -- woman living alone, you can't take any chances. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PATIENCE nods unsurely, starts to retreat into the apartm LONE thinks, calls out to her.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Listen, I was gonna grab a cup of coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONE and PATIENCE move from a COUNTER with COFFEE CUPS in hand. Patience has cleaned up, dressed a little sexier th usual -- she looks good.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: So, did you always want to be a policeman? (beat, rolling her eyes) God, listen to me, Conversation 101.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: (a laugh) Hey, we gotta start somewhere. Actually, when I was a kid, I wanted to be a rock star. They take seats at a small table.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I was kind of a delinquent back then, got into some trouble. There was a cop who helped me out. Made a difference. I figured... maybe I could do the same.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Plus you can still get into trouble.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Right, but for the good guys... So what do you do? When you're not dumpster diving or cleaning chimneys, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Accounting. That is, I used to, I just lost my job.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Don't be, it was pretty dull. I guess when you get down to it, I'm pretty dull. Patience realizes she's not making for a great first date

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Let me start over. It's just... I never got into any trouble or anything --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Come on, never?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Well, when I was little, but -- after I lost my folks I... I guess I turned into sort of a scaredy- ca -- um, pretty risk-averse.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: That's not a bad thing. It's a pretty dangerous world.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Sometimes I just wish I was less of a wimp.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: You're not afraid to admit you're afraid -- that takes guts.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: It does?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Most women I know pretend to be tougher than they really are. (beat) Listen... if you ever need someone -- to look out for you, keep an eye on -- (changing tack) -- or whatever -- I'm available. He pulls a card from his wallet, passes it to her.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Wow. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: (catching himself) Oh hey, I didn't mean that to sound like a come-on

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I mean, unless you... (rising) I'm just going to shut up now and go.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: See you around.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you will. He gives her a wave and heads out of the coffee shop. A broad smile spreads over Patience's face. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL'S SMILING FACE on a BILLBOARD. It's only there for moment, quickly plastered over with -- A NEW BILLBOARD featuring DRINA'S FACE. We're outside a dramatic, gated industrial COMPLEX, TRUCKS with the AVENA LOGO, a sprawling CHEMICAL FACTORY at the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGE VATS, DUCTS, PIPES, etc., it's a busy, VERY NOISY environment. CAMERA FINDS GEORGES' OFFICE, large windows overlooking the factory floor. INSIDE, behind the thick windows, it's SILENT. This is a hard, masculine space, all steel and wood. GEORGES stands by a table, WESLEY and ANGEL at his side; NEVSKI, 50s, a smoldering Russian scientist, is showing t MEDICAL PHOTOS of people's faces, the eyes covered with b BARS -- the skin is BLOTCHED, lumpy, something very wrong (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GEORGES flips through these quickly, his tone frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Okay, with too much YP-3 you get side-effects -- but too much of anything is bad for you -- tap water, sunshine, cigarettes --

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: It's like leprosy or something...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: The point is, now that we've adjusted the formula, Beaunique works. Plumps the skin, removes wrinkles, leaves a nice rosy glow -- it's perfectly safe now, my own wife uses it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice trails off as he considers this fact. He glance at the medical pictures, puts them aside. Airy denial:

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: You want to be beautiful, you've got to make certain sacrifices. I mean, look at Botox, women are lining up to get their faces paralyzed. NEVSKI has been doing a slow burn, now blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: NEVSKI
dialogues.text: Enough! Pretending my YP-3 is only for your cosmetics, feh! You've known about these "side- effects" from the start, they are not side-effects at all --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: What? You're not making sense --

dialogues.speaker: NEVSKI
dialogues.text: I thought I'd left this sort of madness behind me - - then I find out you've been in contact with Xavier Bartok --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: I've never heard of the man. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NEVSKI
dialogues.text: I still have connections. You May have used me, but I am not a fool.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Doctor Nevski, is it possible you've gone insane? NEVSKI spins on his heel and storms out.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Russians, sheesh.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: As if I don't have enough on my mind. GEORGES moves to a nearby SHREDDER. He starts feeding in MEDICAL PHOTOS.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Changes are going to have to be made... and change can be painful. He glances at a MAGAZINE AD lying on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: It isn't easy to eliminate an established brand... Finished shredding the medical photos, he picks up the AD -- it's an AD for BEAUNIQUE, featuring LAUREL'S FACE.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Sir, are you seriously thinking of recalling Beaunique --?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about Beaunique. He slips the AD into the SHREDDER. CLOSE -- as the machin turns THE AD into CONFETTI, we hear the VOICE of LAUREL

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A famous poet once said, beauty is truth, truth beauty... cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOMELESS CAMP -- tents, boxes, etc. -- nearby. BAG LADI stand in a line near MAKE-UP STOOLS, AVENAL GIRLS are bus painting their faces, doing their best.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...or maybe it's the other way around... FIND LAUREL AVENAL at a TABLE with a BANNER: "AVENAL CARE VIDEO CAMERAS are trained on her as she signs POSTERS, PERFUME BOXES, etc. while talking into a MIC.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: The point is, everyone deserves to look in the mirror and feel good about themselves. Be we rich or poor, we all must strive to be more beautiful than we can be... A PROCESS SERVER in a suit with a briefcase reaches Laure places a stack of papers in front of her. She starts to s automatically, then stops, turns off the mic.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: PROCESS SERVER
dialogues.text: Laurel Avenal, I am hereby serving you with a restraining order.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PROCESS SERVER
dialogues.text: You are not to set foot within one hundred yards of any property owned or occupied by Avenal Beauty Corporation or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I -- this must be some sort of mistake --

dialogues.speaker: PROCESS SERVER
dialogues.text: You will, however, have sixty days to remain in residence at the Avenal estate, at the end of which time you and all your personal property must be -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (a desperate cry) Georges Avenal is my husband! The man pulls another document from his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: PROCESS SERVER
dialogues.text: That brings me to this petition for divorce... LAUREL looks shell-shocked. A CAMERA FLASHES. She turns a manages to force a stiff, trembling smile for the photographer. CAMERA FLASHES again, WHITING OUT the frame

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE'S SLEEPING FACE. She stirs, stretches. WIDER, she's lying on top of a BOOKCASE in a twisted, awk position. MIDNIGHT jumps up and brushes against her. CLOSE ON PATIENCE'S EYES -- they FLY OPEN, GOLD-FLECKED a (for a moment) ELLIPTICAL. PATIENCE -- now pure CATWOMAN -- springs down gracefully scans the dark apartment. She stretches her limbs languorously, licks her lips. She flexes her fingers, watching appreciatively as her CLAWS EMERGE. She reaches out and SPEARS LONE'S CARD on a fingernail, regards it as she picks up the receiver. With another CLA she unhesitatingly punches in the number. When she speaks after a beat, her voice is throaty, sexier -- whenever sh Catwoman, she'll talk this way. During the following, she toys with the long PHONE CORD like a cat.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: (on phone) Mmm, too bad you're not there... guess I'll have to go out and play by myself. She tosses the receiver aside and prowls the room, moving casually atop the back of the couch, from there to other pieces of furniture and the counter, hops down to the flo She studies the place as if seeing it for the first time. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: What a dump. PATIENCE plucks at the clothing she wears, frowning. She opens a DRESSER DRAWER and PAWS through the contents, lik cat digging in a litterbox, SHREDDING the clothes.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Ugh -- please -- frowsy -- She moves to a closet, throws open the door, rifling thro the outfits, RIPPING them to bits, hurling them aside.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Damn, I haven't got a thing to wear! True -- she's emptied and trashed the closet, SLAMS the d

dialogues.speaker: MULTIPLE ALARMS RING.
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS of STOREFRONTS, WINDOWS SMASHED -- the SHOE ST the LINGERIE STORE, the WESTERN WEAR SHOP, the TRENDY BOUTIQUE. The MANNEQUIN that had displayed the Gaultier knock-off is now NAKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THRONGS out front behind the velvet ropes. All eyes turn toward an approaching FIGURE whom we don't see at first.. LOW ANGLE -- a sleek pair of black patent leather BOOTS appears. A purring rendition of a familiar children's tun

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: And the cat came back, the very next day... MOVE UP SLOWLY to reveal the rest of the ensemble -- long legs in BLACK TIGHTS, the short SKIRT and bodice TOP of t dress. A WHIP is wrapped around her waist, the tip dangle almost like a tail. Her stride is confident, sexy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: The cat came back, they thought she was a goner... Her arms are encased in long, satiny BLACK GLOVES. A half MASK with eyeholes and subtle cat's ears covers the top h of her face, her hair falls free like a mane behind.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: But the cat came back, she just wouldn't stay awa- a-ay... CATWOMAN -- the former PATIENCE PRICE -- comes to a stop front of the slack-jawed BOUNCER.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: What's the word I'm looking for? Oh yes... Meow. So saying, she strokes a finger under the bouncer's chin CLOSE, the CLAW emerges from a SLIT in the glove's finger but doesn't draw blood. THE BOUNCER recovers himself, unhooking the rope and step aside. Catwoman strides past him into the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dramatic DECOR, throbbing MUSIC, DANCING TRENDIES. CATWOM moves confidently through the club. PATRONS can't help bu stare, getting out of her path as she crosses the room. RANDY and SANDY, the rude couple, are bellied up to the b CATWOMAN slithers between them, almost unnoticed at first RANDY starts as something FLICKS against his back -- CATWOMAN holds the end of her WHIP/TAIL, smacking it ligh against his rear end. He looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Buy me a drink. SANDY stares daggers at Catwoman with her drooling boyfri but Catwoman ignores her, leaning close to the attentive BARTENDER and almost whispering: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: White Russian, no ice, hold the vodka and Kahlua. The man blinks, retreats to fill the order. SANDY taps Catwoman on the shoulder as she makes eyes at Randy.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Excuse me, earth to slut -- he's taken. Without looking at her, Catwoman COUGHS discreetly into h hand, then drops something in SANDY'S martini glass -- SPLASH. CLOSE -- a FURBALL in the woman's drink. SANDY backs away, making a horrified noise.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Euw! The bartender produces a SHOT-GLASS full of cream.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Cream, straight up. Catwoman knocks this back, licks white residue from her l

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Let's dance. She grabs RANDY by the lapel and drags him toward the dan floor -- not that he needs a lot of encouragement. CATWOMAN shoves the man onto the dance floor ahead of her She begins to writhe sensuously to the music, instantly t center of attention. Catwoman's distinctive movements combine catlike grace with acrobatics and martial arts. RANDY does his best to keep up. He moves near, puts his hands on her ass. She hisses:

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Don't touch my tail. CATWOMAN pulls her WHIP from around her waist, FLICKS it the air -- Randy backs off. But Catwoman swings the whip that the braided leather wraps repeatedly around his tors (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She pulls him against her, clutches his butt -- then PUSH HIM AWAY, spinning him out on the whip like a top -- his TROUSERS have been SHREDDED, the belt SLICED. His pants d to his ankles, he stumbles back in his loud bikini underw losing his balance and falling. THE CROWD reacts, laughte

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: That's enough for one night, honey. HE LUNGES at her from behind, but she drops down and slit out of his grasp -- it's like she's vanished into thin ai then CATWOMAN rises behind him, plants a foot in his ass -- and boots him into the DJ'S STATION -- CRASH! MUSIC STOPS. MORE CLUB GOONS appear from the back, approach angrily.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Guess the party's over. CATWOMAN springs upward, atop a BANK OF SPEAKERS. She mov with incredible agility, near the roof of the club, from speakers to a LIGHT RIG -- she leaps and grabs a MIRROR B which SWINGS and deposits her close to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN hurls open the front doors, kicks aside the velv rope. She addresses the impatient CROWD:

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: C'mon in, wanna-bes! Free drinks! THE CROWD stampedes the door. Catwoman struts away down t sidewalk, recoiling the whip around her waist. A couple of CLUB GOONS make it past the throng. CATWOMAN, moving onto a highway OVERPASS, notes she's being pursued She puts a hand on the railing, and casually VAULTS OVER THE GOONS rush to the side, look out to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN strutting confidently down the narrow GUARDRAIL between the two directions of SPEEDING TRAFFIC. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She could be out for an evening stroll, ignoring the SCREECHING BRAKES, HORNS, and STARTLED DRIVERS. She gives them a wave without bothering to look over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHICKEN-WIRE DOOR explodes open and a FLOCK OF PIGEONS ROCKETS OUT of a COOP AT CAMERA. CATWOMAN emerges in a CLOUD OF FEATHERS, brushing a few s ones off her outfit, with a cat-that-ate-the-canary smile She cocks her head, listening in different directions for new source of amusement -- snippets of VOICES, MUSIC, PLUMBING SFX, passing VEHICLES... it's like tuning a radi Then she picks up a distant TINKLE of breaking GLASS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dimly lit, an older, discount place. THIEF #1 methodicall breaks DISPLAY CASES with a wrapped hammer, snatches up t contents -- necklaces, rings, etc. -- stuffing them into BAG. As he moves, a SHADOWY FIGURE -- CATWOMAN -- moves with h looking over his shoulder, close enough to touch but unse Each time he turns his head, she has just slinked out of view -- her timing is impeccable. THIEF #2, with a SHOTGUN, stands guard over a blindfolded bound-and-gagged NIGHT WATCHMAN. CATWOMAN appears on the periphery of his vision, but when he turns his head she's disappeared behind a case -- she emerges on the other sid just before he turns back. THIEF #3 is at work on a LOCKED STEEL CASE of DRAWERS with a BLOWTORCH and TOOLS. CATWOMAN STEPS LIGHTLY across the CASE above him, he looks up -- but there's nobody the He returns to his work, gets the CASE open and pulls out DRAWER revealing a RACK full of glittering DIAMONDS.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oooh, pretty. THE THREE THIEVES spin, looking around --

dialogues.speaker: THIEF
dialogues.text: Up there! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THIEF #2 aims his SHOTGUN at -- CATWOMAN, perched on a narrow LEDGE at the ceiling mouldi She VAULTS down just as he FIRES, a SPRAY OF PLASTER. THIEF #2 pumps his shotgun, looking around frantically.

dialogues.speaker: THIEF
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?! CATWOMAN springs out from behind a DISPLAY CASE, gives Th #2 a roundhouse KICK in the head that sends the man into wall, knocking him cold. THIEF #1 pulls a HANDGUN, but the END OF THE WHIP wraps around it in a flash, yanks it from his hand. CATWOMAN SNAPS HER WHIP at Thief #1 and Thief #3, backing them into a corner. As she passes the tied-up GUARD, she uses her claws to SLASH his ropes. In time with WHIP CRAC

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: You boys -- thought you could just barge -- in here and take -- all these beautiful things -- that don't belong to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard quickly tears off his GAG and BLINDFOLD, untyin his own feet, then picks up the fallen handgun and trains on the thieves. We hear POLICE SIRENS APPROACHING. CATWOMAN meanwhile swiftly gathers up fallen jewels, swee them into the swag bag. She pauses for a moment, thoughtf

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: (to herself) What a lovely idea. With lightning speed, she vanishes out the back with the THE GUARD, totally focused on the thieves, doesn't even register she's gone. THIEF #3 points --

dialogues.speaker: THIEF
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN bounds out the exit, leaps atop BOXES, onto a wi A/C UNIT, which totters with her weight, just as -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AN UNMARKED SEDAN screeches to a halt, and TOM LONE leaps out, GUN ready. He trains it on CATWOMAN --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Freeze! CATWOMAN freezes. She blinks down at LONE, he's got a cle shot at her. She cocks her head, licks her lips.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: You are cute. LONE blinks at this uncommon response to a pointed weapon continues to play it by the book.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I'm a police officer!

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Bet you look sweet in uniform. And such a big gun...

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I, I -- Come down here, now!

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Obviously you don't know much about cats. I come when I want, not when I'm told. With that, she SPRINGS to the rooftop -- the force of her leap knocks the A/C free of the window, LONE has to dive of the way as it CRASHES to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN, silhouetted against the sky, is having a great time, leaping from building to building, scrambling acros rooftops. POLICE SIRENS recede in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SUN is rising. PAN OVER a couple of GLITTERING JEWELS the dirt. FIND CATWOMAN in the GOLDEN MORNING LIGHT, curl against what looks like a TIGER-SKIN PILLOW. She stirs an groans in her sleep, like someone waking with a hangover. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She blinks and frowns at the SUNLIGHT. Where am I? She si up and realizes -- she was sleeping against the belly of BENGAL TIGER, lying on his side in his sunken ENCLOSURE. CATWOMAN SHRIEKS and leaps to her feet, terrified, yanks HER MASK. With the daylight, she's back to being plain ol PATIENCE. She looks down in shock at her revealing outfit the swag bag is looped into the whip around her waist. She's awakened the TIGER. Patience lets out another frightened CRY as he eyes her, no longer recognizing her friend. The tiger GROWLS, gets to his feet menacingly, starts moving in for the kill. PATIENCE scrambles for a heavily LATCHED DOOR, which she frantically wrestles to open, getting through and SLAMMIN just as the TIGER LUNGES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KITTEN pounces on a CAT TOY.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: -- but this time, it was like the tiger wanted to kill me... MOVE TO FIND PATIENCE, seated at Edna's kitchen table, finishing her tale. She's in tight-fitting jeans, RIPPED along the sides, a cut-off top revealing her midriff. Saf pins hold the outfit together, but it looks good on her. EDNA is pulling out teacups, a TEAKETTLE on the burner.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: You were afraid -- you became its prey. The tiger shredded your clothes?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: No, I did that myself. I mean, I remember doing it, but it wasn't really -- you know -- me. God, I don't understand what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: I'm not sure how to put this -- it may be hard for you to accept -- but I'm something of an expert in these matters -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: What matters?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Vampirism, lycanthropy... feligyny.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (lost) Um...

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
