dialogues.text: Feles, Latin for cat. Gynos, Greek for female. I'm a professor of folklore and mythology -- that is, I used to be, until I was denied tenure. They said my work was frivolous, but it was an all-male department, and -- well, it's a long, sordid story

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Edna, please. Can we talk about me?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. The other night... I think you may have... had an accident. A very serious accident. Fatal.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (as if to a child) But -- I'm not dead.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Not anymore, dear. After you died, you were reborn. As a catwoman. A dramatic WHISTLE. EDNA takes the TEAKETTLE off the stov

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Mint or chamomile? PATIENCE is beyond speech -- what Edna just said is impossible, and yet makes sense to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN OVER PRINT-OUTS, PAPERS, open BOOKS. A HIEROGLYPHIC o figure half-feline, half-female in a heavy TOME. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: The cult of catwomen dates back to Ancient Egypt, where felines were first domesticated. A SMALL CAT suddenly LEAPS INTO FRAME, staring UP AT CAME EDNA, in her reading glasses, and PATIENCE are seated bef the research material spread on her desk, cups of tea bef them. Edna patiently removes the CAT.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Cicero. ON PAPERS -- a DRAWING of the TEMPLE OF BAST.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: The temple of the Catgod, Bast. A Persian army destroyed it in the fifth century BC. EDNA's tone is sad, as if this memory were fresh and pain

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Legend has it that the priestesses became the first catwomen. The cats they'd worshipped -- Midnight's ancestors -- each gave up one of its nine lives to bring them back from the dead. ON A BOOK, images of MEDIEVAL WITCHES with their cats.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: In the middle ages, cats and catwomen were regarded as evil. Nonsense, of course, witches were just single, independent women who broke society's rules. EDNA passes Patience -- A BLACK AND WHITE print-out of a blurry SURVEILLANCE SHOT SELENA KYLE, as seen in "Batman Returns."

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: There were reports of a catwoman a while back on the East Coast -- like many, she turned to a life of crime -- but apparently she's disappeared or died. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PATIENCE studies the photo.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: How many have there been?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: No one can be sure. I've found references scattered through history, but catwomen tend to lead solitary, secretive lives. Hard to blame them, it seems most were murder victims. PATIENCE has heard enough. She rises, freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I was murdered? Why would anybody kill me? No, I never did anything to... I don't want to break the rules! She moves out of the room, Edna follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE paces, EDNA looks on sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: She's like some demon, possessing me in the night, but -- but I can keep it under control during the day --

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Well, cats do sleep most of the day --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: When she takes over -- it's like, she just does whatever she feels like, she doesn't care what people think --

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Is that so bad?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: You don't understand -- I'm afraid she's going to hurt someone -- or get me killed. Again. PATIENCE is near tears. EDNA puts her arms around her. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: There's got to be a way to make it stop. Some kind of, I don't know, garlic or wolfsbane or something...

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: (thinking) A domestic cat can return to its natural state effortlessly. But once a cat's gone feral, it can never be tamed.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Okay... that isn't helping. EDNA pulls back, looks Patience in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Relax a little, learn to live with your inner cat. Even love her -- she has many admirable qualities -- integrate her into your life. If you accept the darker impulses, try to channel them -- maybe she'll come to be domesticated --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: No. I'm going to fight her. I'm stronger than she is --

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: But you're only fighting yourself --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: -- and I'm going to win. Patience heads out the door. Edna shakes her head; Patien isn't getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE TAPE across the entrance to the storefront. PATIEN approaches warily, looking around to make sure no one's watching, nervous as hell. She sees an elderly JEWELER an UNIFORM COP through the window. Patience withdraws a PAPER BAG from under her coat. She drops this beyond the police tape, KNOCKS on the door and RUNS. THE JEWELER comes out, looks down on the ground. He picks up the bag -- and sees the word "SORRY!" written on paper. Opening the bag, he finds -- THE DIAMONDS AND JEWELS that Catwoman stole.  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE comes out of a back door of her building with a GARBAGE BAG, still looking around nervously, moving towar the dumpster in the alley. She tosses in the bag -- ANGLE IN DUMPSTER, the BAG spills open to reveal pieces o the CATWOMAN OUTFIT. PATIENCE moves back for the door --

dialogues.speaker: LONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We've got to stop meeting like this. She spins to see TOM LONE approaching from his sedan, par in a LOT off the alley. PATIENCE is wary of him now, but seems casual, smiling. She glances at the dumpster anxiously, he follows her sight-line, snooping as always.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Doing some spring cleaning?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Emptying the catbox, actually. LONE quickly takes a step back from the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: So -- that was a... surprising message you left for me.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Oh, well, uh -- musta been my cold medication talking. She sniffles and coughs unconvincingly.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Well anyway, if you still wanted to get together -- maybe we could get a bite to eat Friday night? PATIENCE pretends to think it over.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE dances with MIDNIGHT, overcome with joy. She hol the cat at arm's length, sings a TUNE of her own making: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Tom Lone, Tom Lone, I called him on the phone -- now I won't be alone -- THE CAT isn't enjoying this, squeals and squirms free. Patience's smile fades a tick.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: It was Catwoman who made the call. What's he ever gonna see in me? MIDNIGHT has turned his butt to her, tail TWITCHING angri PATIENCE glances OUT THE WINDOW to glimpse -- LONE, who's just entering his apartment. PATIENCE quickly CLOSES THE BLINDS. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR OPENS and PATIENCE enters. She keeps her head do not wanting to be noticed. SALLY spots her, follows her through the showroom toward the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Patience, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Just came by to clean out my desk.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (studying her) Hm. Did you dye --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: -- your hair. You look different somehow. Cooler. Patience shakes her head, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Are you going to the funeral? (peering at her) I know, tinted contacts. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) What funeral?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You didn't know? Dave Berger, your boss -- his whole place blew up, gas explosion, the night you got fired.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (reeling) Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, life's short, huh. (snaps her fingers) The hottie neighbor! That glow, you're getting some, aren't you? Patience reaches the door to the elevators, waves Sally o and vanishes. Sally grins, figuring she's got it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GARFIELD TOY lands atop XEROXED CARTOONS and personal PAPERS in a CARDBOARD BOX. PATIENCE is cleaning out her cubicle in the office. Notic a flashing LIGHT on her phone, she hits a MESSAGE BUTTON picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: BERGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filter) Patience, it's Dave... She winces at this voice from the grave, casts a sad glan toward his empty office.

dialogues.speaker: BERGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I called the CEO about your YP-3 numbers -- Avenal went ballistic. I'll have to redo the spreadsheets, you must've screwed up somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Like hell.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: End of final message. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Patience absorbs this a moment, then sits down and TURNS her COMPUTER with a PING. ON PATIENCE'S COMPUTER SCREEN -- the words, "YP-3 PROJECT text and the names of a few PEOPLE in charge. PATIENCE leans forward, reading quickly, quietly to herse

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Miracle ingredient in Beaunique... just a drop makes wrinkles vanish, blah blah blah...' But what is it? Patience types away, focused on the screen, finds somethi We see the name IVAN NEVSKI.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Dr. Ivan Nevski, in charge of development. (types) j Huh, not in the company directory. QUICK CUTS as she types the name into a GLOBAL SEARCH BOX reaches a HEAD SHOT of NEVSKI, a SITE in CYRILLIC LETTERI She finds a TRANSLATION LINK. As the lettering changes to ENGLISH, we go CLOSE on key phrases: "SOVIET DEFENSE," SECRET RESEARCH," "CHEMICAL WEAPONS," "BACTERIAL WARFARE PATIENCE sits back, baffled and disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE is sitting up in bed, reading a BIOCHEMISTRY TEX PRINT-OUTS and RESEARCH MATERIAL around her. She YAWNS, squirms -- something is coming over her. Her eyes pop ope

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: No. Oh no, not again. SPASMS wrack her body, her back arches, she keeps fightin it, clenching her fists, struggling for control. ON HER HANDS, her own CLAWS are drawing BLOOD from her pa  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLOVED HAND grips the edge of the DUMPSTER -- then CATW vaults over the side, lands on her haunches, ready to rum Her outfit has a banana peel stuck to it. She wrinkles he nose, plucks this off, CLUCKING her tongue. She turns to MIDNIGHT, prowling nearby.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: That girl has got to go. She glances up toward Lone's WINDOW -- lets out a sexy GR -- and SPRINGS UP the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN SCRATCHES at the window... the place is DARK, no response. She PUNCHES out a pane of glass and slithers in

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Boy, you don't know what you're missing... She moves through the dimly lit, Spartan environment, abl see easily in the dark. She runs a CLAW over the strings a GUITAR, finds a discarded button-down SHIRT, slips it o She narrows her eyes when she finds a FRAMED PHOTO -- CLOSE -- TOM LONE with his arm around a pretty GIRL. Lett out a GROWL, CATWOMAN slashes out the girl's face. IN THE BATHROOM, she opens the medicine chest, picks up m toiletries. Finding a bottle of COLOGNE, she sprays it in the air and sniffs, then makes a face, looking at the bot CLOSE ON BOTTLE -- "MACHISMO... by AVENAL."

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Avenal... MOVE IN ON CATWOMAN'S FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressionistic POV FLASHBACKS, V.O.s overlapping, echoin repeating... all snippets of previously heard dialogue. POV -- GEORGES AVENAL, chewing Patience out in the ELEVAT (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: EDNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Most catwomen were murder victims...

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was murdered? POV -- the MERCEDES COMING AT CAMERA. This time we follow through on the moment of IMPACT -- CAMERA FLIES THROUGH T AIR, HITTING the ground hard.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Why would anybody kill me?

dialogues.speaker: ... YP-3... YP-3...
dialogues.text: POV -- from PATIENCE, lying on the street. HER BLURRING VISION drifts toward the MERCEDES, a SILHOUETTED FIGURE behind the wheel, seen from behind.

dialogues.speaker: BERGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Avenal went ballistic... POV -- ANGEL comes out of the car, LOOMS over Patience.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I have no choice. POV -- GEORGES on the elevator, staring INTO CAMERA. ANGE is right behind him, looking menacing as usual.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: You've got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH! CATWOMAN throws the COLOGNE BOTTLE against the wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling MANSION, dark for the night, an "A" in iron scroll-work over the gate. FIND a SECURITY CAMERA, traine on the area in front of a ten-foot WALL. MIDNIGHT suddenl leaps onto the wall, blocking and batting at the CAMERA L WIDER, CATWOMAN, now out of the camera's view, LEAPS up t side of the wall and lands on all fours atop it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AT THE SIDE OF THE MANSION -- CATWOMAN scrambles up a tre toward a second-story window. She leaps to the ledge, crouches, peering in. CLOSE as a razor-sharp CLAW emerges and CUTS a CIRCLE int PANE OF GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CIRCLE OF GLASS pops out and lands on soft CARPET. CATWOMAN reaches her arm in, unlatches the window, and sw inside into the darkness. CATWOMAN moves stealthily, crouching, senses alert.

dialogues.speaker: CATVISION
dialogues.text: The dark hallway GLOWS. An amplified NOISE from a distance... SNORING.

dialogues.speaker: ON CATWOMAN'S HANDS
dialogues.text: Her NAILS emerge from her gloved fingertips, ready to rum CATWOMAN rounds a corner toward a large formal staircase wraps around a huge chandelier. She nears a door which is slightly ajar, pushes it open silently and enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER POV -- CATVISION, nearing a huge, curtained CANOPY BE CATWOMAN slashes the curtain aside, to reveal -- TIPPY THE LAP DOG, curled up in the center of the otherwi unoccupied bed, SNORING away. The dog awakens, raises its head, and starts BARKING FURIOUSLY. CATWOMAN hisses at the creature. It cringes and shivers, seeking cover beneath a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CATWOMAN comes out of the bedroom, a FIGURE emerges fr the darkness swinging a GOLF CLUB -- WHAM! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She's struck hard in the back and the head -- she topples forward, ROLLS DOWN THE STAIRS. She hits a LANDING, curle up, dazed, clutching her skull. LIGHTS COME ON -- LAUREL looks down at her from the top o the stairs, wearing silk pajamas, golf club in hand. She descends cautiously, club raised. LAUREL tentatively pokes at the prone, black-clad Catwoma with her foot. CATWOMAN instantly SPRINGS UP. As Laurel starts to bring the club down, Catwoman grabs it and yank away, hurling it into the foyer below, then grabs LAUREL slams her against the wall. Laurel seems utterly terrifie

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Oh God, please -- please don't hurt me! CATWOMAN studies the frightened woman, easing her grip. Laurel drops the act, and with a martial arts SHRIEK driv KNEE and a FIST into Catwoman in rapid succession -- CATWOMAN flies over the banister, grabbing a hold of the chandelier. It swings in the open foyer -- THE CHAIN creaks ominously, starts to rip from the ceilin CATWOMAN snaps the whip around an upper BALUSTRADE, just THE CHANDELIER rips loose from the ceiling. As it CRASHES the ground, CATWOMAN swings back at LAUREL and -- KICKS HER in the chest. LAUREL goes down hard on the stai CATWOMAN stands over her. LAUREL looks up at her, outrage The two women are of similar size and shape, well-matched

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: That was Venetian crystal, you bitch -- LAUREL launches a karate KICK at her, CATWOMAN deflects i lands a blow of her own.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: A bitch is a dog. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The two engage in martial arts combat, moving down the st into the marble foyer. They exchange lines between BLOWS:

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: You're tougher than you look.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Took classes when I was modeling in Hong Kong. (lands a good one, then: ) Damn it, I broke a nail. She's a skilled fighter, but CATWOMAN is faster, more nim able to avoid her attacks. Laurel suddenly pauses, lookin winded, ready to give up the fight.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Had enough?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (nods, eying her outfit) Is that a Gaultier? Catwoman looks down at her clothes, giving Laurel the cha to grab a VASE OF FLOWERS, which she hurls at her -- IT SHATTERS, soaking Catwoman. She shakes off water.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I hate water. Suddenly enraged, she lunges toward LAUREL, who hits the ground -- but CATWOMAN springs over her head, up to the landing where the LAPDOG yaps. She snatches it up by its collar, bares her CLAWS near it face. THE DOG shuts up, petrified.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: No, please -- not Tippy!

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Where's your husband? A BEAT as Laurel takes this in. She lets out a little lau

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Georges? Why didn't you say you wanted him in the first place? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN slowly puts the dog down, it scampers upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: You one of his girlfriends? CATWOMAN springs back down, shoves Laurel against a wall, flexing her CLAWS.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I don't belong to anybody.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Not my face, not my face!

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: If I can't get to Georges, I can at least scratch up something he loves --

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Georges doesn't love me! I don't know if he ever did --

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: How sad. I'd cry if I cared.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: He never took me seriously, I was just a, a trophy. And now he's bored, he found himself a new toy --

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I've heard this story before. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (thinking frantically) He never comes home anymore -- I, I know he's got a box for the ballet Friday night --

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I can't wait that long. I want him now.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I swear I don't know where he is, he's left me! Oh God, my career is in the toilet, my whole life is over -- go ahead, tear me to pieces --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LAUREL is beginning to get hysterical. Catwoman lets out frustrated GROWL and lets go of her, this is useless. She starts for the door, Laurel sniffs back tears then follow

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Wait... try the factory. I think that's where he meets Drano, his new mistress.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I'll check it out.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: What do you want with him, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: It's personal.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Are you going to kill him?

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Depends on my mood.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I'll pay you to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: (surprised, impressed) And here I thought you were just some brain-dead mannequin --

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I'll even give you a lift, if you'll let me watch -

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, I work alone. But I like your attitude. Catwoman disappears into the night. LAUREL looks after he admiringly. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOOD MUSIC plays, GEORGES is on the sofa, in a silk robe, beside DRINA. Drinks are on hand, Georges is attempting t neck with her. She pays him no mind, a remote in hand, rewinding a VIDEO that plays on a plasma SCREEN. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON TV, IMAGES OF DRINA dissolve into each other quickly -- she DANCES IN A BALL-GOWN, CHAIRS a CORPORATE BOARD MEETING, finally pulls into the winners' circle in a FORM RACE CAR, pulls off her helmet and shakes her hair out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Discover the fountain of youth... in a jar. Beaunique by Avenal. DRINA hits pause, wrinkles her nose.

dialogues.speaker: DRINA
dialogues.text: I look fat.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: We'll shoot another. Georges moves in on Drina, as the CAMERA discreetly pans the WINDOW over the factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small crew of NIGHT WORKERS wearing JUMPERS and PAPER M tend the elaborate industrial MACHINERY, it's DEAFENING h SWIRLING GOO the color of HUMAN SKIN PUMPS through PLASTI PIPES into a huge SEALED VAT. RAINBOWS of NAIL POLISHES squirt out of NOZZLES into BOTT LIPSTICK STICKS screw down into their TUBES and are CAPPE CONVEYOR BELTS. OVERHEAD, amidst DUCTING and PIPES, CATWOMAN is on the mo HER CLAWS rake across a row of RUBBER TUBES, which spray multi-colored FLUIDS. HER GLOVED HANDS spin hydraulic VALVES. HER BOOT kicks a CONVEYOR BELT WHEEL, twisting it sideway the BELT JAMS, SMOKE rises from the clogged gears. A PANEL slides open over a bank of SWITCHES and WHACK-IT buttons. Her gloved fingers start HITTING THEM at random. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WITH A WORKER DRONE, CLICKING a hand counter by rote as C of neatly-packed jars of NAIL POLISH pass by his station. The man is half-asleep. A CASE COMES BY, a bit crooked on the belt, which is beginning to VIBRATE... The next CASE missing half its bottles. An ALARM BLEEPS, RED LIGHTS FLASHING in b.g. The next CASE is filled with BROKEN GLAS DRENCHED in NAIL POLISH -- it gets his attention. He THRO LEVERS to stop the belt. WIDER, THE FACTORY is in CHAOS. STEAM shoots out of PRESSURE TUBES, COLORED LIQUIDS bubble out of overflowing TANKS, FACE POWDER sprays into the air from a disconnecte HOSE. WORKERS dash about frantically, SHOUTING and PANICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CHAOS in the factory is clearly visible through the window, but GEORGES can't hear a thing -- he and DRINA ar groping each other on the couch now. A nearby INTERCOM is BUZZING, Georges finally pushes a ta button, angry.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: This had better be import -- oh my God. He's now looking out the window at the CHAOS below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MACHINERY is off now, but the place is a wreck, CLOUD STEAM and POWDER, RIVERS of NAIL POLISH on the floor, etc A handful of panicking WORKERS struggle to shut down a la DISTILLATION VAT, which RUMBLES ominously. SECURITY GUARDS are pouring in, one speaks rapidly into a WALKIE-TALKIE, looking upwards as he climbs stairs to a network of catwalks overlooking the factory.

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE-TALKIE
dialogues.text: Better stay in your office, sir, keep the door sealed. The saboteurs may still be on the premises.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filter) Who is responsible for this?! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As if on cue, CATWOMAN LEAPS down from above, planting a in the man's back -- the walkie-talkie flies from his gra she catches it in mid-air, holds it to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: That would be me, Georgy boy. ANGLE THROUGH WINDOW, WITH GEORGE, looking down on the ru factory as Catwoman appears on a catwalk just below the window, strutting her stuff, speaking into the walkie-tal

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Come out of your hole, let's have some fun. NUMEROUS GUARDS are approaching from various directions, moving to surround Catwoman.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?! Who are you? Catwoman CRACKS her WHIP.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: A kitten with a whip. You like my makeover? I even had my nails done -- As the guards near, she drops the walkie-talkie, LEAPS an WRAPS the WHIP around a PIPE above the WINDOW, SWINGING r past George, CLAWS EXTENDED -- -- LEAVING FIVE SCRATCH MARKS in the glass right in front his face. He jumps backwards instinctively. She lands on a catwalk, near more GUARDS. They move in brandishing NIGHTSTICKS. HIGH-ANGLE as the guards surround CATWOMAN -- no easy esc

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Here, kitty kitty... CATWOMAN bares her teeth, lets out a menacing HISS. A NIGHTSTICK swings at her, she easily dodges the blow, bending backwards in a way impossible for a mere mortal. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Another guard SWINGS at her, she grabs the end of the nightstick and pulls him toward her, snatching a can of M off his belt and BLASTING him in the face with it. He's blinded, lets out a cry as she tosses him aside. THE OTHERS come at her at once. CATWOMAN plays them again each other, LEAPING and DODGING, landing KICKS in their CHESTS, leaving Zorro-like SCRATCH MARKS across their uniforms whenever she gets the chance. WITH GEORGES and DRINA, awed by the martial arts display.

dialogues.speaker: DRINA
dialogues.text: Find out where she got those boots. Georges shakes his head, seething. WITH CATWOMAN, A FIST comes at her face, she twists her h SINKS HER TEETH into the attacker's wrist, BONE CRACKS.

dialogues.speaker: BITTEN GUARD
dialogues.text: Ow! You fight like a girl!

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Duh. So saying, she shoves another GUARD into the path of a swinging STICK, which knocks him unconscious. She SOMERSAULTS over the heads of the remaining attackers, sh about to get away when GEORGES' VOICE erupts over a PA.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Just shoot the bitch! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! ANGEL has appeared on the catwalk, brandishing a HANDGUN, FIRING wildly. CATWOMAN dodges and dives from the catwalk, landing -- -- on her feet on a narrow PIPE below, one amongst severa She moves quickly, leaping easily from pipe to pipe -- ANGEL'S BULLETS barely miss her, RICOCHETING, causing GUA and WORKERS below to dive for cover. One BULLET STRIKES the rumbling DISTILLATION VAT --

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I'm not finished with you, Georgy! So saying, she dives into a large DUCT leading downward.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN rockets downwards, BULLETS PERFORATE the DUCT WO just behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE VAT EXPLODES UPWARD like a VOLCANO, DRENCHING ANGEL a the GUARDS with FLESH-COLORED FOUNDATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARKNESS, A GRILL EXPLODES from the ceiling with CATWOMAN IMPACT, she topples through and lands on a TABLE of GLASSWARE, which UPENDS, we hear GLASS SHATTER. CATWOMAN is instantly on all fours on the ground, breathi hard. She moves through the dark room, becoming aware of HUNDREDS OF GLEAMING EYES. CATWOMAN flips on a WALL-SWITCH -- -- revealing GLASS-WALLED CAGES containing SQUEAKING BLAC RATS. CATWOMAN instinctively HISSES and SWIPES A CLAW in their direction -- they shrink back from the glass. MANY HUGE DRUMS stenciled "YP-3" are stored against a far wall, near HOODED CLEAN SUITS and BIOHAZARD SIGNS. CATWOMAN spots a LIST of names and numbers on a bulletin board. She snatches this, studying it -- CLOSE -- the name IVAN NEVSKI, with an ADDRESS and NUMBER cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neatly kept, colorful architecture. CATWOMAN moves down sloping eaves and swings into a turret window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN moves stealthily inside the dimly lit place. It' upscale, expensively furnished. She scans the room, sees (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NEVSKI, his back turned, apparently dozing in a desk chai CATWOMAN spins him in his chair to confront him --

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Ivan Nevski -- His head tilts back -- she's face-to-face with a CORPSE, been shot a couple of times in the chest. He's bluish, ey glazed -- very dead.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: (annoyed) You're no help. She SNIFFS the air, turns toward -- -- a SMOLDERING FIRE in the FIREPLACE. Catwoman moves tow this, studies the ASHES and BURNED PAPERS, then reaches i and snatches out -- -- the REMAINS of a TEXTBOOK. The cover reads "YERSINIA

dialogues.speaker: PESTIS
dialogues.text: The book is hot to the touch, she DROPS it, studies it.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Yersinia Pestis... YP... A SINGED NEWS CLIPPING protrudes from between the pages, plucks this out. CLOSE -- "BUSINESSMAN DENIES TERRORIST LINK," with a PHOT XAVIER BARTOK, his name in the caption below. CATWOMAN is reading, absorbed, when -- THE FRONT DOOR swings open -- A UNIFORM COP and a LANDLAD with a ring of keys step inside --

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY
dialogues.text: Dr. Nevski, are you all -- aah! They see CATWOMAN. She HISSES, bolts for the window and vanishes while the COP still fumbles for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lush vegetation and tropical sunlight through walls of netting in this immense camouflage tent. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES PAST racks of AIR-TO-AIR MISSILES, RPGs, a J FIGHTER and a large military CARGO CHOPPER. XAVIER BARTOK, a well-dressed, heavyset man with a CIGAR his mouth, accompanied by a couple of BODYGUARDS, is show off a crate of AUTOMATIC WEAPONS to a couple of REBELS in combat fatigues. They speak in rapid SPANISH, examining t guns, sighting them, etc. XAVIER excuses himself to answer a ringing CELL PHONE. He speaks with a vague European ACCENT.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on phone) Acquisitions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WESLEY is on his cell phone on the main FACTORY FLOOR. Th place is a WRECK, as WORKERS clean up the mess Catwoman m

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on phone) This is supply. There's been a slight complication, my employer wishes to move up the exchange -- tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: (snorts) Impossible -- there are issues of transport, available funds --

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: We're willing to adjust the price. But if you can't pick up the goods tomorrow, we'll have to take our business elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: This isn't your first 'complication.' WESLEY unlocks a door to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FREIGHT ELEVATOR rises to reveal MANY CANISTERS of YP-3. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WESLEY waves to ANGEL at the controls of a FORKLIFT -- An still has dried flecks of MAKE-UP on his skin. He pulls forward, ready to load the YP-3 into a waiting TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on phone) It'll be eliminated, like the others. We just don't want to take any chances. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TV, AN ARTIST'S RENDITION of CATWOMAN, made to look fa more menacing and mean.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Catwoman has struck again -- FOOTAGE of a sheet-covered CORPSE being wheeled out of Nevski's duplex. A BANNER: "CRIME BREAK," a LOCAL NEWS LO

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This costumed criminal has now added murder to her resume of mischief and mayhem... REVERSE ANGLE -- PATIENCE, sprawled on the couch in baggy sweat-clothes, reacts to this with a stunned expression. ON TV, "NEWS VIDEO" of SANDY from the club.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- she attacked us for no reason! And her outfit, I mean, that whole S & M thing is so 90s -- THE DOORBELL RINGS, PATIENCE moves to answer, attention s on the TV. She throws the door open quickly -- TOM LONE takes a step backward, hands up defensively.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Just me --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Our date... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: (amused) Way to cover. Patience looks from Lone to the TV behind her --

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: Catwoman. Who is she? PATIENCE quickly grabs a remote and FLIPS OFF the TV. She then looks back at Lone, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I -- I'll only be a minute. She quickly grabs some clothing, darts toward the bathroo At the last moment she spots the CAT MASK on the floor an -- KICKS it UNDER THE COUCH as she moves into the bathroo LONE steps inside, can see his apartment across the way. calls through the half-open door as she changes:

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: By the way, last night -- you didn't happen to see or hear anything -- my apartment was broken into.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, sorry -- I never look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Weird, they didn't take anything, just broke a bottle of after-shave and slashed a picture of my sister. WITH PATIENCE, getting dressed. She smiles, delighted.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Your sister, that's -- (catching herself) -- really a shame. LONE has moved to the kitchen table, where the numerous RESEARCH BOOKS and HANDWRITTEN NOTES are spread out. ANGLE ON BOOK -- A diagram of a BACTERIA, a drawing of a the entry "YERSINIA PESTIS." (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: What's Yersinia Pestis?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bubonic plague.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Bubonic plague? Why are you -- ? ON PATIENCE as she exits the bathroom, looking good.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: It's sort of a hobby of mine... She trails off, stopping in her tracks as she sees LONE, who's holding up her WHIP with a dubious expression

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (off-handedly) Oh, I had kind of a kinky boyfriend once. PATIENCE takes the whip and casually tosses it aside, but Lone's suspicions are fully aroused.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Where should we eat?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I dunno... you like sushi? cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER comes through a BEADED CURTAIN, passing LONE and PATIENCE seated nearby, drinks before them. The curtain RATTLES after him, distracting PATIENCE.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: So what've you been up to lately?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Me? Oh. Not much. You know, sitting around my apartment, watching television. As she speaks, she involuntarily BATS like a kitten at th swinging CURTAIN. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Is that so hard to believe? What about you?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Catwoman. Patience starts, folds her hands in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: It's the case I've been working on.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. I guess I heard about it.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I'm not surprised. Talk about your media circus.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Well, she is interesting, isn't she? Kind of a... colorful character?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: She's a thief and a killer.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (heatedly) I don't believe that. (covering) I mean -- whatever happened to innocent until proven guilty? LONE seems a little taken aback at her vehemence. Just th a JAPANESE WAITER places a HUGE TRAY OF SUSHI between the

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Guess I went a little crazy ordering.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: It's refreshing. A lot of women won't let a man see them eat.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Right, then we go home and binge on Haagan-Dazs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: During the following, Lone meticulously mixes soy sauce a wasabi, uses chopsticks, etc. Patience simply peels the f off the rice and pops it in her mouth, as if eating potat chips, then licking her fingers like a cat licking its pa

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: You do hide things, don't you. You may seem all sweet and shy, but you've got a secret wild side.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Women in general, you mean.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Right. Women in general... (watching her reaction) You know, I actually saw Catwoman the other night. From a distance. Goofy costume.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Really? I heard it was... sexy.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: In a way.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: So it could be sexier... with what, maybe a wide belt?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Why so interested?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: You brought it up. LONE studies her for a few seconds. He seems on the verge saying something important. But instead:

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: You want that toro? LONE is already reaching for another piece of sushi -- wi lightning reflexes, PATIENCE grabs his hand to stop him - looks up at her, surprised. She backs off with a smile:

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: No no, it's yours. She eyes the fish hungrily as he eats it.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONE and PATIENCE walk close together, near the water.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Gonna have to get back to the station, I'm working nights.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Catwoman again?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Afraid so. But I have a feeling she'll be in custody within the week.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Individuals who feel compelled to act out through an animal alter-ego -- bats, birds, bugs, there have been a number of cases in other cities -- they catch themselves. Take too many risks, think they can play with the cops. See, they like to be watched... He's staring right at her now. Patience looks away. HER POV -- THE SUN GETTING LOW, vanishing behind a cloud. CLOSE, PATIENCE'S PUPILS become ELLIPTICAL for a blink. LONE pauses, standing close.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Seems like all I can do is talk about work. PATIENCE spins on him, a glint in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: So stop talking. So saying, she throws her arm around his neck, the other around his back, pulls him close for a KISS. Lone takes o a moment to respond -- it's a good one -- until -- CLOSE ON LONE'S BACK as her CLAWS involuntarily emerge, tearing right through his shirt and an inch down his back -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LONE jerks away, looking back over his shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: ow! PATIENCE clutches her hands to her face, horrified at wha she's done, starts backing away --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry, I don't know what got into me, I -- I've got to go. She's on the run. A moment later, the surprised Lone pursues, rounding a corner...

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Patience, wait -- But she's already vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE is breathing hard, blinking rapidly, as she pace Edna's floor. Edna follows nervously, trying to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: It's happening, it's happening again. It's not even dark yet -- you said she could only come out at night!

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: I didn't say that! Patience, you made these rules up yourself -- a cat is a cat 24 hours a day, they just go hunting at night --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: And she's after Georges Avenal -- if she finds him, she's going to kill him, I know it --

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Stop talking about her like she's someone else! She's you! A beat -- Patience is in denial about this.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Edna, you've gotta... tie me up or something, lock me in the attic -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: I don't have an attic --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: A closet, the pantry, something! Please... we have to keep the cat in tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDNA stands in the opening of the angled storm cellar doorway, looking down the stairs sadly.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Sure you don't need a blanket, dear? ON PATIENCE, at the foot of the stairs in this cold, dank space, hugging herself, rocking back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Just... lock... the door. Edna quickly CLOSES the door, throws a BOLT. It's extremely DARK down below. Patience starts to pace. see her features contort with pain as she fights this interior battle. During this monologue, her voice becomes huskier, more Catwoman-like.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I'm not a bad person... I'm not a killer... I'm not evil... not like Georges Aaavenal... His name becomes a harsh GROWL. She fights to get a grip.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: He's a murderer... he did this to me... it's all his fault. Her eyes FLICKER, elliptical for a moment --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: He has to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN UNEARTHLY HOWL ECHOES throughout the place from heater vents in the floor. In response, THE CATS go nuts -- prowling, pacing, bouncing off the walls, picking up the  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDNA sits at her table over a simple meal, attempts to re CAT FANCY MAGAZINE, but it's pretty hopeless. She shuts h eyes, covers her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sour NEIGHBOR pokes her head out an OPEN WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: Edna, I've had it with your damn cats! I'm calling the cops! She SLAMS the window SHUT. CAMERA MOVES to find -- -- THE STORM DOORS, bolted shut. MIDNIGHT ENTERS FRAME, begins to CLAW at the metal, slowly working the BOLT free EDNA emerges, sees what's happening, dashes over. She carries a PADLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Midnight! Shoo! Midnight HISSES, but retreats sulkily. Edna reaches the nearly free bolt, is about to replace it and lock it when hears a small, timid VOICE from below, through the door:

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Edna? Edna, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Yes, dear, I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Edna, it worked. I think... I think I've beaten her. I'm Patience again. I've won.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm so glad... Edna looks terribly relieved as she throws aside the bolt begins to open the cellar door. But before she can -- -- THE DOOR FLIES OPEN, knocking her off her feet. A FIGU STREAKS PAST. We hear her voice as she retreats:

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Sucker. cut TO:  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BALLET in progress -- "Giselle." Lithe DANCERS spin gracefully across the stage, a rustic village setting. FIND a HIGH BOX to one side. GEORGES and DRINA, in formal clothes. GEORGES is absorbed in the performance, DRINA lo bored, wrinkles her nose.

dialogues.speaker: DRINA
dialogues.text: What is this about?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Ssh. (impatient whisper) Giselle is mistreated by a cruel prince and kills herself. Later, the souls of betrayed women come back from the grave for revenge. DRINA makes a SNORING NOISE, puts on a WALKMAN, and is so bobbing her head to faint ROCK MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BALLET MUSIC CONTINUES OVER. A CITY BUS passes, an AD FOR AVENAL on the side -- it's been VANDALIZED, CLAW MARKS ac the length of it. CRANE UP to find CATWOMAN crouched on the roof of the bus She leaps off from the still-moving bus -- -- onto the ROOF of a TAXI passing the other way -- -- and finally landing at the curb near -- A classical-looking CONCERT HALL, FOUNTAINS in front. CATWOMAN creeps amongst bushes, approaching the building. Numerous COPS patrol the entrance -- no way to get past t CATWOMAN creeps around the perimeter, looking for another in. By the curb she spots -- ANGEL, alone, near a parked LIMOUSINE, lighting a cigaret

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Those things'1ll kill you. She SMACKS the cigarette out of his hand, BOOTS him into BUSHES and leaps on top of him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: IN THE BUSHES, CATWOMAN straddles ANGEL, bangs his head against a cement curb.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: YP-3 -- the plague -- what's it for?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you're -- BANG! She whams his head again.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Tell me about Xavier Bartok.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: How do you know -- She BANGS his head again.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I'm asking the questions.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I -- I can't tell you -- She bares her CLAWS over his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Then it's time to brush up on your Braille.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: No, no, not my eyes! Xavier, he's the one who's buying the stuff!

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: The deal goes down tomorrow night -- at the Avenal offices --

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Wrong. Your boss won't live to see it. She BANGS his head hard again, ANGEL loses consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN moves around the side of the building, keeping l ducking behind parked cars. Fewer COPS here, but the plac looks impregnable, no way to scale the walls. She tries a EMERGENCY DOOR -- locked, no good. She hisses in frustration, starts to move on when -- THE DOOR OPENS behind her. CATWOMAN spins to see -- LAUREL, her face hidden with dark glasses and a wide-brim hat. She gestures frantically. Catwoman darts inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL whips off the hat and glasses, gives a girly hug t Catwoman, who pulls back immediately.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come. Laurel leads Catwoman through this basement boiler room.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: He's with his bimbo in a box to the right of the stage. But there's all kinds of security -- he's pretty scared of you.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: He should be. How much do you know about your husband's operation?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I know he's built an empire out of women's inadequacy and self-hatred --

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, but the secret ingredient in his face cream -- it's black plague bacteria. He's selling it to an arms dealer.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (touching her face) Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: And he's committed murder to protect his secret. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Nothing he does would surprise me anymore. He's a monster. You should've seen the pre-nup, I don't get a dime -- CATWOMAN has reached an emergency STAIRCASE, cuts her off bolting upward.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I'll take it from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN slinks along a hallway, past a couple of bored y USHERS. They give her a sidelong look. Cats is next month... UNIFORM COPS are clustered near a FORMAL STAIRCASE, block her access to the right-hand side of the hall. CATWOMAN bares her teeth in frustration. She hurries towa a VELVET ROPE, the sign, "BOXES - PRIVATE." She slips pas the rope, moves to a far door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN OLD COUPLE SNORE through the ballet. CATWOMAN appears behind them in the box, snatches OPERA GLASSES from the woman's lap and scans the hall -- HER POV, ZOOMING from box to box -- finding GEORGES in a on the opposite side of the hall. DRINA is rising, headin out the door. CATWOMAN climbs up the CURTAINS around the box, levering herself upward to the elaborate FRIEZE that wraps around top of the hall -- GREEK GODS in various dramatic poses. WIDER, FROM BELOW, as CATWOMAN climbs and creeps near the ceiling, moving over the PROSCENIUM ARCH above the stage, heading toward GEORGES. A POLICEMAN at ground level spots her -- he lifts a radio his lips, calling for backup. The BALLET below is reaching a crescendo. COPS are filing from the back of the theatre, trying to be discreet. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WITH GEORGES, still absorbed in the ballet. Suddenly CATWOMAN lands in the empty seat beside him, staring at t stage herself. A whisper:

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I love this part. GEORGES spins, startled -- and she SLASHES HIM across his cheek. The MUSIC is so loud, no one hears his CRY OF PAIN GEORGES rushes for the exit -- but CATWOMAN gets there fi shoves a CHAIR under the doors.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Let's not be interrupted. She advances on him, BLOOD drips from the SLASHES on his cheek, staining his tuxedo shirt.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Red's a good color on you. At that, she grabs Georges and slams him against the wall the box, behind a curtain, partly concealed from view. Th DOOR RATTLES, increasingly hard. CLOSE as CATWOMAN wraps a hand around Georges' throat, th CLAW TIPS digging into his skin. He gasps:

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: No -- please --

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I could rip out your throat...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGES
dialogues.text: Why -- why kill me?

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Because you deserve it. And because I can. THROUGH BINOCULARS -- CATWOMAN holding Georges, but still delivering the deathblow. LAUREL spies from the back of the theatre. Under her brea

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: C'mon honey... just do it. CATWOMAN'S HAND trembles on Georges' throat. His eyes wel up with tears, his expression pleading, desperate. Sudden (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN releases him, throws him GASPING to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Damn it. I can't. THE CHAIR SPLINTERS and the DOOR flies open, ARMED POLICE with DRINA behind them. CATWOMAN leaps to the lip of the box, turns and HISSES, t -- jumps down to the middle of the stage, amidst the DANC AUDIENCE UPROAR, MUSIC STOPS, COPS charge up the aisles -- CATWOMAN does a pirouette, bows and bolts into the wings. After a puzzled BEAT, the CONDUCTOR waves his baton and g the show going again. LAUREL looks agonized -- Catwoman was so close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES as CATWOMAN darts between stored PROPS an FLATS from a GRAVEYARD SCENE, bowling over costumed DANCE Seeing POLICEMEN blocking an exit, she dodges between DRO scrambles up a FLY-LINE -- POLICE track her from below -- she leaps between sandbagg ROPES as the BAGS drop, scrambling higher onto the GRID -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON STAGE, inappropriate SCRIMS and PROPS descend and rise again. DANCERS dodge and weave as a GIANT GARBAGE CAN (th Cats) descends in the midst of the VILLAGE SQUARE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN darts effortlessly across the overhead grid, whe

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Freeze! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TOM LONE, anticipating her move, has climbed a ladder to grid. He trains a gun on her -- CATWOMAN freezes. She stares at him, breathing hard, taking a moment to come to grips with this adversary. LONE advances on her, stepping gingerly.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: You're under arrest -- He steps on a flimsy support, which starts to give way. Catwoman is alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Watch out! LONE sways, losing his balance, she springs and grabs his arm, saving him. A beat as they look at each other, then -- she SNATCHES the gun out of his hand, tosses it aside, then grabs his tie and pulls his face to her to LICK his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Tag, you're it. She bounds away, comfortable on the narrow railings. Lone pursues, moving more carefully now. Accompanied by the ballet music, the two perform their private dance, high a the TOMBSTONES and GRAVES. CATWOMAN winds up in a corner on a MESH PLATFORM, no way from here, but for a 25-foot drop to -- THE FLOOR, where POLICE await, pointing upward. LONE advances, he has her trapped. He pulls HANDCUFFS.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Handcuffs. Yummy. He lunges at her -- she dodges, kicks a leg out from unde him. No slouch at fighting, Lone recovers, plants a kick her mid-section. She gasps, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: You play rough.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: This isn't a game. He charges at her, but she parries a blow, lands a SLASH across his shoulder. As he comes at her again, she jumps grabs an overhead ELECTRICAL cable, swinging away -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lone has too much momentum, he loses balance, about to go over the edge -- CATWOMAN swings back like a pendulum, wrapping her legs around his neck, saving him from fallin She swings him back over the platform, tries to kick him but he grabs her legs, pulling her and SNAPPING THE CABLE STAGE LIGHTS go out, ELECTRICAL SPARKS fly as they hit th platform together, she lands straddling him, catching the SPARKING CABLE just before it strikes the mesh.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Be careful! That thing hits the metal, we're both fried! CATWOMAN leans close, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I knew there was a spark between us. She turns and flings the cable away, it dangles free of t mesh floor, still spitting SPARKS. A second later, CLICK LONE has slapped a handcuff on her wrist, CLICKS the othe cuff over his own. CATWOMAN spins back on him, looking hu He reaches to pull off her mask. She slaps his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Please, it's our first date. I wouldn't want the mystery to go out of our relationship. LONE struggles to push her off, but she keeps her thighs locked around him. He finally rolls on top of her.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: We don't have a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: (mock sadness) You men love the chase, but once you catch us, you always lose interest. As she speaks, CLOSE on her cuffed hand -- her fingers squeeze together, her hand slithers out of the cuff like cat's paw. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LONE rises, tries to pull Catwoman to her feet -- but he comes up with an empty, dangling HANDCUFF. From the ground, CATWOMAN plants a kick in his back from behind, he falls forward and SLAMS his FACE HARD into a L RIG. Catwoman winces, sounding a lot like Patience:

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. She's on her feet, ready to scamper off, but -- MORE COPS have made it to the grid, blocking every way do ANGLE DOWN, COPS have covered every exit below. LONE glares up at her.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: And here I thought we were hitting it off... With that, she leaps and grabs the dangling POWER LINE wh TEARS LOOSE from the ceiling -- She DROPS to the floor, still holding the CABLE. COPS surround her, moving in quickly, guns drawn -- She backs toward the wall, near a CIRCUIT BREAKER PANEL.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Show of hands -- who can see in the dark? She lifts her own hand daintily, then violently SWINGS TH POWER CABLE into the CIRCUIT BREAKERS -- A FLASH, a BANG, a SHOWER OF SPARKS -- then -- PITCH DARKNESS. We hear SHOUTS from the theatre, people PANICKING, and a series of GRUNTS and OOFS as Catwoman ta out the nearest adversaries -- CATWOMAN POV -- CATVISION, FIGURES have a pale outline, t EYES GLOW, as CATWOMAN dispatches her unseeing opponents.  94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIDE DOOR swings open and CATWOMAN darts out. She's alm home free when SHOTS RING OUT behind her -- ANGEL, staggering out from the bushes where she clocked h FIRES his handgun after her. CATWOMAN stumbles and rolls, but keeps moving. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDNA holds a few CATS in her arms, WEEPING quietly, tissu close at hand. There's a sound of SCRATCHING at the windo she moves to open it, revealing -- CATWOMAN, exhausted and bruised from her battle. She craw in the window, as Edna stares in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Patience?

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Not exactly. She throws herself on the end of the bed, curling up with other cats, examining her injuries. She finds a bloody GA where Angel's bullet grazed her skin. EDNA moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Oh dear. You've been shot. Edna hurries into the bathroom and emerges with a small FIRST-AID KIT, begins tending to Catwoman's wound, still sniffling.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: It's nothing to cry about.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: No, it's my cats. Last night, all that noise -- the neighbors complained. Animal Control says they're a health hazard...

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Piss on em.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: They're coming tomorrow to take them away, have them destroyed -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: It won't happen. I promise. EDNA studies Catwoman, speaks softly, worried.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Did you do it? Did you kill him? CATWOMAN shakes her head, disgusted with herself.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I wanted to -- but I couldn't. I actually... felt sorry for him.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Because you're still Patience Price.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Don't remind me. That girl is so weak.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: No, she isn't. You know that. Catwoman makes an exasperated noise, then YAWNS.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I could really use a nap. So saying, she rolls over and falls asleep at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE, in borrowed clothes, moves toward the entrance her building, limping and tired. She climbs the steps.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Patience. TOM LONE, wearing SUNGLASSES, approaches tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh! Hi. Listen-- about last night...

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Forget it. I, um... listen, I'm sorry about this. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He takes a few steps back as -- -- a PAIR OF PATROL CARS SCREECH to a halt, coming up on sidewalk in front of Patience's building. COPS armed with SHOTGUNS leap out, train their weapons on her.

dialogues.speaker: PATROL COP
dialogues.text: Hands in the air! TWO MORE COPS throw open the entrance door behind her, HANDGUNS ready. PATIENCE, cornered, looks shocked and betrayed. She raises her hands timidly. LONE removes his shades -- we now see he has a nasty BLAC EYE, his face swollen. Still, a hint of regret in his voi

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Patience Price, AKA Catwoman, you're under arrest. You have the right to remain silent... ON Patience's stunned expression -- cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grim-looking ANIMAL CONTROL WORKERS methodically ferry CA CAGES from Edna's open front door to a VAN in front. EDNA scurries helplessly from cage to cage, saying goodbye, fighting back tears. MIDNIGHT slashes at a WORKER and escapes. But a KITTEN, l agile, is shoved into a CAGE. As the DOOR SLAMS SHUT -- cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE is in a JAIL JUMPSUIT, alone in a small, dingy r with the usual one-way mirror and table. THE DOOR is opened by a COP and LONE enters.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: This is all a mistake -- Tom, you know me! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: (shakes his head sadly) One thing you learn in this line of work -- you never really know anybody, not completely. (professional tone) You're being charged with vandalism, burglary and the murder of Doctor Ivan Nevski --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: He was dead when... um, Ivan who? (a beat, floundering) You, you have no proof that I -- what are you doing? LONE is unbuttoning his shirt. He pulls down one side to reveal his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: These scratches were inflicted last night by Catwoman. Forensics also tested this scratch -- He turns around to show the claw-mark she left when they kissed. He turns to face her, rebuttoning his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: They were made by the same implement.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: So this whole time, you've been flirting, buying me dinner, acting like you were interested -- I was a suspect? It was just some cat and mouse thing? LONE's a little offended, his tone becomes more aggrieved

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: No, not at first -- I really bought the act, vulnerable girl all alone in the big city --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Sorry if I don't fit into your damsel in distress fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: That's not what -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Real people are a little more complicated.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Look, I didn't want to believe it, but --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I guess a strong woman can be intimidating to a certain kind of man --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Did you really think I wasn't gonna recognize you in a little mask? I'm not blind.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: So if they don't need rescuing, you better lock them up yourself -- They're now talking over each other, sounding just like bickering lovers. LONE glances at the mirror, embarrassed; they're obviously being watched. Through his teeth:

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Knock it off. (flat, Sgt. Friday) It'll go a lot easier on you if you just confess now.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I've been doing some investigating of my own. A real crime. Georges Avenal is stockpiling YP-3, a variant of black plague bacteria --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Oh yes, your little hobby. Please, Patience --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: It's a bioweapon! Ivan Nevski developed it, they must've killed him to keep it a secret --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: So now you've constructed a paranoid fantasy with your former boss at the center. A disgruntled employee -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: The deal's going down tonight, they're meeting an arms dealer named Xavier Bartok at the Avenal offices --

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: You're hallucinating. Georges Avenal is world famous, worth millions, a respected businessman -- why in God's name would he get involved in arms trafficking?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I don't know! Why don't you ask him?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Enough. Are you denying you're Catwoman?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (looks away from him) It doesn't matter what I say. You'll make me whoever you want me to be. LONE looks at her for a moment, then exits, leaving Patie to study her own defiant expression in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE paces in her own CELL, talking to herself:

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Damn it, it's getting dark out, where are you...? She stares at her hand, trying to will claws to appear -- nothing. A deep breath, concentrating, mantra-like --

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: I am Catwoman... I am... She opens her eyes -- it's no good. cut TO:  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gloriously handsome GROOM stands beside a VEILED BRIDE an altar. ORGAN MUSIC PLAYS. A REVEREND beams at the couple, nods at the young man, wh throws back the veil -- the bride is DRINA -- caught CRACKING a piece of CHEWING GUM. An 0O.S.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: cut! WIDER, as DRINA takes the gum out of her mouth, we're at COMMERCIAL SHOOT. 35mm CAMERAS, KLIEG LIGHTS, etc.

dialogues.speaker: DRINA
dialogues.text: I wasn't ready! Beside the harried DIRECTOR sits GEORGES, butterfly BANDA over the scratches in his face.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: We're gonna be at this all night. Drina approaches, looking for a place to put her gum.

dialogues.speaker: DRINA
dialogues.text: Line?!

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: (wearily) I do. With Beaunique.' She nods, crouches and sticks the gum UNDER A PEW. AN ASSISTANT has a cell phone to her ear, leans toward Georges, speaks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: It's Detective Lone, apparently they've caught the Catwoman. Georges smiles, breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: He's coming by later, says he wants to ask you about another matter. Georges narrows his eyes and cocks his head at this. cut TO:  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON PATIENCE, lying in her bunk, miserable. We hear the so of a CAT CRYING, distant, almost as if it were in her hea She opens her eyes to see -- MIDNIGHT, mostly in shadow, pacing on the other side of a high, mesh-covered window. ON PATIENCE, for a moment we see the GOLD, ELLIPTICAL PUP WIDER, Patience -- now CATWOMAN -- springs to her feet an studies the BARS of her cell. As she did at the zoo, she begins to ease her body between them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of desks, PLAINCLOTHES and UNIFORM COPS in a bustlin crowded bullpen area, a hive of activity. PATIENCE/CATWOMAN enters in her JAIL JUMPSUIT -- she can' fight her way through, so she tries a different approach. She moves stealthily through the room, using her heighten reflexes to avoid being seen. It's an intricate choreogra of split-second timing, turned heads and diverted glances She ducks down to crouch as a CART PASSES... A PLAINCLOTH COP spins idly in his swivel chair, PATIENCE/CATWOMAN cir behind him.... PATIENCE/ CATWOMAN rolls a signed BASEBALL across a desktop, knocking over a PENCIL CUP. As the ASSISTANT bends to retrieve it, PATIENCE/CATWOMAN steps lightly over her desk -- -- and makes it OUT THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FULL MOON just above the rooftops. CATWOMAN rises INT FRAME in full regalia, silhouetted, then LEAPS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE from a reversed WINDOW SIGN to a SKYLIGHT above -- CATWOMAN leaps through it and lands on the floor in a SHO of glass. She hurries towards the KENNELS. CATWOMAN bypasses BARKING DOGS, HISSING at them as she do She turns a corner and finds -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DOZENS OF CATS behind bars. CATWOMAN flings the cages ope the grateful CATS stream out. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA ROLLS ON DRINA and the GROOM at the altar. IN b.g. we glimpse a DARK FIGURE, moving low between the nearby P

dialogues.speaker: DRINA
dialogues.text: I do. She turns TO CAMERA, holds up a JAR OF BEAUNIQUE.

dialogues.speaker: DRINA
dialogues.text: With Beauni -- A BLACK-GLOVED FIST SMASHES her HARD in the FACE. Drina STAGGERS BACK, clutching her NOSE, SHRIEKING, BLOOD spill on her wedding dress --

dialogues.speaker: DRINA
dialogues.text: No! I just had this fixed! GEORGES and the DIRECTOR are both out of their chairs, stunned at the sight of -- CATWOMAN, in the midst of sudden PANDEMONIUM on the set. reaches into her bodice and removes a small HANDGUN. CREW MEMBERS SCREAM and duck for cover as -- BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! CATWOMAN SHOOTS GEORGES in the chest, h collapses, dead instantly. CATWOMAN throws down the gun and sprints behind an ALTAR SCREEN and out of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DARK MERCEDES, with only ONE HEADLIGHT, and a DENTED FRONT END, weaves quickly around slower traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN drives like a maniac, looking over her shoulder. She lets out a sudden WHOOP of delight -- she did it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She hits a SPEED-DIAL button, we hear a phone RINGING as PEELS off the CAT MASK -- and a WIG... it's LAUREL AVENAL We hear XAVIER'S VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are we on?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Oh honey, we are so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOS, PARAMEDICS, COPS, a FORENSICS TEAM photographing George's corpse. Nearby, other COPS bag the HANDGUN. TOM LONE is here, on his cell phone, heading for the exit

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: (on phone) Yeah, we got a couple dozen witnesses, it was Catwoman. Looks like it might be the same weapon that killed Nevski...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONE moves outside, past FILM TRUCKS outside this urban church, still on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: (on phone) Nah, couldn't have been Price after all, musta been a lab error. You better cut her loose right away or she's gonna have a hell of a lawsuit on her hands... yeah, be there soon, I just gotta tie up a couple loose ends. He climbs in his sedan and moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONE'S SEDAN pulls up near the entrance to the office tow As he gets out, he hears a CHOPPER coming in overhead and looks up to see -- The AVENAL BEAUTY sign high above, a TWIN-ROTOR CHOPPER approaching the helipad. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LONE moves toward the showroom entrance, tries the door - locked. He sees the entrance to the PARKING GARAGE, moves down the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MILITARY CARGO CHOPPER touches down. XAVIER and FOUR MERCENARIES emerge. Two mercs carry ALUMINUM SUITCASES, a are armed with AUTOMATIC WEAPONS. In addition to chopper SOUNDS, there's a WHISTLING WIND up here and the WHITE NO ROAR of A.C. DUCTS. LAUREL, still in the cat suit but without the mask, is waiting. XAVIER approaches, a small BRIEFCASE in hand. Laurel's manner is cold, professional, all business -- sh couldn't be more different from the victimized female we up here at the outset.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: Your husband?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: He won't be a problem. Ever again. And I'm not even a suspect. She gestures to her outfit. Xavier nods.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: American women. I'm always impressed.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Let's do some business. They head down the stairs. CAMERA MOVES, off the roof, to the roof of an adjacent, lower SKYSCRAPER -- and finds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE REAL CATWOMAN. She paces, breathing hard, steeling herself for something, looking toward the Avenal building A WINDOW WASHER RIG hangs halfway down the building, but quite a distance from this roof edge.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I can do this... right? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She's addressing MIDNIGHT, who non-commitally licks a paw CATWOMAN moves to the far end of the roof and sprints tow the edge, leaps for all she's worth -- CATWOMAN sails through the air in a perfect arc, toward t window-washer rig... but she's going to fall short and pl twenty stories. At the last second, she pulls out her whi and snaps it out around -- -- the cables of the rig. CATWOMAN SLAMS HARD against the side of the building, dangling from the whip.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Ow. She struggles to pull herself upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALUMINUM SUITCASE opens -- STACKS of HUNDRED DOLLAR BI WIDER, WESLEY handles the suitcase. He starts to count th stacks of money, testing random bills with a COUNTERFEIT Meanwhile, Xavier's MERCS are moving aside the LADDERS an PAINT CANS. One yanks down the frilly DRAPERIES to reveal CANISTERS OF YP-3, dozens of them in a cutout portion of wall, more than we've seen before. Laurel's been hiding t here all along. Xavier opens his briefcase -- there's a TESTING KIT inside.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: May I? So saying, XAVIER plucks a WHITE ROSE from an arrangement He seals it into a clear PLASTIC CONTAINER, moves to a random canister, and attaches a NOZZLE tightly to the VALVE. Cautiously, he releases a small amount of PRESSURIZED LIQUID into the container. CLOSE -- as the MIST makes contact with the ROSE, the PET turn PINK, then RED BLOTCHES appear. Abruptly, the petals BLACKEN, WITHER and ULCERATE. The flower is a shriveled m in seconds. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: Nice. XAVIER carefully removes the nozzle, nodding appreciative at the canisters.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: Avenal should think about getting out of cosmetics altogether -- chemical weapons are a growth industry. THE MERCS, with slightly nervous looks, begin carefully moving the canisters out of the penthouse, up the stairs the helicopter. THE ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN -- it's ANGEL.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Look what I found. He lifts the semi-conscious LONE from the floor -- the ma been bound, gagged and blindfolded with DUCT TAPE, there' bruise on his head. ANGEL flashes LONE'S BADGE.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: He's a cop. Found him sniffing around the basement.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Oh beautiful. (waving a hand) Put him in there for now... Angel drags LONE into a CLOSET near the make-up mirror, shoves him inside and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: What are we going to do about this?

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: (a shrug) I'll be flying over water. I could drop him off. Laurel nods and smiles gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING, CATWOMAN holds a button on t WINDOW WASHER'S RIG, which rises toward the roof.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MERCS methodically move canisters from the penthouse, the stairs, to the CHOPPER on the helipad, where a PILOT waits at the controls -- the ROTOR BLADES spin lazily. MERCENARY #1, winded, calls to the PILOT, who's absorbed copy of SOLDIER OF FORTUNE:

dialogues.speaker: MERCENARY
dialogues.text: Wanna pitch in?

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Not my job. MERCENARY #1 exchanges a look with MERCENARY #2, shakes h head, deposits his canister in the chopper. As he moves b for the stairs he hears moving HYDRAULICS. He heads towar the far edge of the helipad, WEAPON ready. He sees the MOVING CABLES of the window washing rig come to a STOP, h looks cautiously over the edge... HIS POV -- the PLATFORM has come to a stop just a few fee below the rooftop. But it's empty. ANOTHER ANGLE -- CATWOMAN is clawing her way around the corner of the building, just below a narrow CORNICE. She' dangling precipitously over a forty story fall. She approaches a WINDOW into the PENTHOUSE below the heli CATWOMAN POV -- on LAUREL in the CATWOMAN suit, chatting XAVIER while the MERCS ferry YP-3. ON CATWOMAN, her eyes widen with the realization -- Laure

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: You cow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WESLEY slips a few BUNDLES of BILLS into his pocket and CLOSES an ALUMINUM CASE.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: It's all here. I've taken my cut.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: All right, Wesley. LAUREL opens a HUMIDOR, offering a CIGAR to Xavier: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Shall we? XAVIER takes a cigar, sniffs it. With mock concern:

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: Cuban. Aren't these illegal? They both chuckle as they head out to the garden area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERCENARIES #3 and #4 are in the back of the chopper, securing the canisters. #1 and #2 head toward the stairs, for another load. MERCENARY #1, in the rear, passes a low A.C. DUCT. THE WHIP LASHES out from behind him, wraps around his throat -- he can't cry out as it YANKS him back behind the duct. hear a nasty THUNK. One down. ON THE STAIRS, MERCENARY #2 turns around.

dialogues.speaker: MERCENARY
dialogues.text: Tony...? No sign of his buddy. He moves back up the stairs and -- -- GETS HIT IN THE FACE with Merc #1's GUN BUTT. He rolls down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: XAVIER and LAUREL have their backs to the stairs, SMOKING their CIGARS, as the unconscious MERCENARY hits the groun short distance behind them. They don't notice. Laurel stretches her arms luxuriously, enjoying the feel of the wind. Xavier studies Laurel, a bit lasciviously.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Free at last... to eat what I want, wear what I want, look like a slob if I want... You have no idea how good it feels.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: I was thinking after this business is over, you might spend some time with me on my island --

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Thanks, no. I'm through with men.  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERCENARIES #3 and #4 emerge from the chopper, looking ar for the others. As they start to circle the chopper -- -- CATWOMAN swings around from behind them, hanging from slowly spinning ROTOR BLADE, she KICKS THEM BOTH from beh and sends them flying head-first to the asphalt. Merc #3 is knocked cold, Merc #4 rolls over on the ground FIRING A BURST behind him. But when the blade comes aroun again, she's gone. He has no idea what hit them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL and XAVIER both react to the GUNFIRE, dropping the cigars, hurrying for the stairs.
