dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PILOT leaps out, a HANDGUN ready.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: What the hell are you shooting at?

dialogues.speaker: MERCENARY
dialogues.text: I don't know! ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CHOPPER, CATWOMAN clings to the FUSELAGE. Seeing a FUEL TANK -- CLOSE -- her CLAW pierces the ALUMINUM SKIN and FUEL star to spurt out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WESLEY and ANGEL have emerged from the penthouse, alarmed just as LAUREL and XAVIER nearly trip over the groaning MERCENARY #2.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: What the hell --? Xavier takes the man's AUTOMATIC WEAPON, he and Laurel hu up to the helipad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL and XAVIER reach the top of the stairs, followed b WESLEY and ANGEL, just as -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN leaps down to the penthouse level from the helip The group is stunned to see the injured men. MERCENARY #1 crawling out from behind the A.C. DUCT. LAUREL angrily gr a MACHINE GUN from the dazed MERCENARY #3. To Xavier:

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Where did you find these clowns?! MERCENARY #4 and ANGEL scout the helipad's perimeter, gun the ready. WESLEY nervously backs toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: If it's all right with you, Laurel, I'd just as soon be going... Xavier is looking around frantically.

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: These are good soldiers. It would take a team of men --

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: (realizing) Or one woman.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look what I found! All spin to see -- CATWOMAN standing at the edge of the helipad, above the s drop, holding THE TWO SUITCASES out to either side of her She has a lit CIGAR clenched between her teeth. Behind he the SKY is LIGHTENING with approaching dawn. ALL GUNS are trained on Catwoman, except Laurel's.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Don't shoot, you idiots! She'll drop the money-- They don't lower their guns. Catwoman narrows her eyes, speaks around the cigar.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Henchmen, Laurel? How tacky. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She jerks one of the cases -- the latch has been loosened POPS OPEN and CASH GOES FLYING into the wind -- DRIFTING from the rooftop to the city streets below. LAUREL reacts in agony.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: No, please-- don't do that again! CATWOMAN drops the emptied case and pulls the cigar from mouth with a distasteful expression. Eying Laurel:

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Don't you hate it when somebody shows up at a party wearing the same dress? LAUREL advances on Catwoman.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Let's face it -- we're alike, you and me. Catwoman ignores her, shouts to XAVIER and his men:

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: You guys gotta be careful with this YP-3 stuff. It's a living thing, you know, a bacteria. If it gets too hot -- it dies. XAVIER looks from Catwoman to the FUEL pooling on the helipad, putting two and two together. He jerks his head his mercs -- they start backing away toward the stairs. LAUREL is still focused on the money.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Let's split the rest of the money -- and there's more where that came from --

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Tempting offer... We would make a pretty good team. Beyond the law, fighting the yoke of male oppression, sisters under the skin... LAUREL nods hopefully. CATWOMAN looks thoughtfully at the cigar in her hand. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Nah, I still have to live with myself. So saying, she flicks the LIT CIGAR to the helipad -- IGNITING the spreading pool of gasoline -- XAVIER ET AL. sprint to LEAP OFF THE HELIPAD or CHARGE DO THE STAIRS as -- THE HELICOPTER EXPLODES in a glorious FIREBALL. LAUREL is thrown across the helipad by the BLAST, showere with CHOPPER DEBRIS. The men are hightailing it out of there, but Laurel gets slowly to her feet, machine gun ready, bent on revenge. Spotting CATWOMAN darting through the SMOKE and FLAMES to the stairs, LAUREL FIRES a volley with a SCREAM of rage a charges after her in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL hurries down the stairs to the garden, FIRING at - CATWOMAN, as she darts into the penthouse. Catwoman's nea hit, showered with broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof CREAKS ominously, the room is thick with SMOKE. LAUREL charges in, sees movement near THE ELEVATOR and FI A BODY goes down with a CRY. LAUREL laughs triumphantly, moves to find -- ANGEL, dead on the floor. LAUREL winces.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Sorry, Angel. CATWOMAN leaps at Laurel from behind, the GUN goes flying The two women CRASH into the CLASSICAL SCULPTURES, shatte them in the course of their struggle. Laurel keeps going the gun, but Catwoman won't let her get near it.  113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WESLEY, XAVIER and his MERCS hurry from the elevators. They've almost made it out the exit to safety when an EER HOWL erupts --

dialogues.speaker: XAVIER
dialogues.text: What is tha -- MIDNIGHT leaps onto his back, sinking his fangs in. A bea later, DOZENS of EDNA'S CATS attack the men; they scream they try to pry frenzied felines from their flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATWOMAN and LAUREL continue their battle. Catwoman gets Laurel down, near victory, when -- BEAMS OF SUNLIGHT from window penetrate the SMOKE and catch CATWOMAN full in the face. She backs away, squinting, disoriented -- this give Laurel the chance to recover.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: No -- I need more time -- WHAM! LAUREL gets in a devastating BLOW that sends CATWOM reeling. At the same moment, LONE KICKS OPEN the CLOSET DOOR. He's still gagged and blindfolded, hands and feet bound, but he's struggling, GRUNTING now. CATWOMAN takes this in, shocked. She moves to Lone's side

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Tom... Laurel picks up the machine gun. FLAMES are spreading fro the ceiling, DOWN THE WALLS.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: You know this guy? Catwoman raises a hand, curls her fingers -- but no claws emerge. She looks toward the WINDOW where -- -- THE SUN is now fully visible. Laurel strides over and KICKS CATWOMAN away from Lone -- rolls across the ground helplessly. Laurel casually point the weapon at Lone's head.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: No! Don't do it! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Why not? He's just -- a man. Catwoman starts to rise, LAUREL steps on Lone's throat, t gun still pointed at his head.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Move a muscle and you won't have a date for the prom. Catwoman freezes, sits back down again. Laurel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: It's amazing. We're the stronger sex -- but men are like Kryptonite. They make us so weak... She increases her pressure on Lone's throat, he WRITHES, CHOKES. Catwoman sounds just like Patience now.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN / PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Stop it, please -- you'll kill him.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I know exactly how much a man can take. Laurel takes her foot off of Lone, he struggles for air. moves in on Catwoman.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: You know, I was actually starting to admire you. LAUREL CLOCKS HER with the GUN BUTT. CATWOMAN/PATIENCE tr to crawl away, BLOOD at her lips.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: When I think of all the guys I had to... use. WHACK! She BOOTS CATWOMAN in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: And there you were, clawing your way up on your own. But you let me down. She KICKS her again. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I ask one little favor -- but no, I had to take care of Georges myself. And now... this. You've ruined everything. She pulls CATWOMAN halfway to her feet and SLUGS her face LAUREL then GRABS the top of the CAT MASK and YANKS it of PATIENCE looks up at her weakly, eyes rolling. LAUREL blinks, a shocked double-take, backs away.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: No... it's impossible... you're dead. PATIENCE's crumpled figure recalls the position of her bo lying on the pavement, the night she was murdered. Her ey go wide as she puts it together.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh my God... it was you...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: OBJECTIVE SHOT, ANGEL near Patience's body. CAMERA MOVES the MERCEDES. The DRIVER'S DOOR opens and LAUREL steps ou looking at Patience's body on the ground with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You were behind the wheel that night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE leaps at LAUREL with blinding speed, CLAWS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: It was you! LAUREL is overwhelmed by the sudden turn. PATIENCE/ CATWO knocks the GUN from Laurel's hands. Laurel dodges her kic and blows, pushed closer to the flames. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: What do you want, an apology? Of course it was me, it was always me -- I ran the YP-3 operation right under Georges' nose, I couldn't let some frumpy accountant blow the whistle when I was so close -- PATIENCE/CATWOMAN slashes at Laurel's head with a HISS -- peels off HALF LAUREL'S FACE -- it's like a form-fitting Mission: Impossible" LATEX MASK. Beneath, the skin is BLOTCHED with DARK SPOTS and SORES. LAUREL lets out a hideous SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: No! My face! PATIENCE/CATWOMAN knocks her to the ground, straddles her The fight's gone out of LAUREL now, she clutches at her disfigured features. Patience/Catwoman cocks her head, looking at the shredded LATEX hanging from her claws.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: So I'm not the only one hiding behind a mask.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: I was the first to try Beaunique -- I was over 30, I had nothing to lose. When the symptoms started to show, it was too late... As she speaks, Laurel peels away the remains of the LATEX

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: So you upped production and sold the stuff to an arms dealer.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: Life hands you lemons, you make lemonade. A FLAMING BEAM gives way, blocking the STAIRWELL, part of CEILING collapses -- this gives Laurel the chance to squi out from under PATIENCE/CATWOMAN. But instead of going fo the gun, she runs straight for the make-up mirror. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN runs to Lone's side, pulling him away f the spreading flames toward the ELEVATOR. She SLASHES the tape that binds his wrists. LAUREL, meanwhile, opens a hidden COMPARTMENT by her mirr revealing numerous LATEX MASKS. She begins to apply a new one, using adhesive, smoothing wrinkles, hiding the seams etc. Nearby, her PORTRAIT starts to MELT and turn to ASH. THE CEILING BUCKLES, chunks of MASONRY falling. PATIENCE/CATWOMAN is prying open the elevator doors.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Laurel, you better get out of here --

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: In a minute -- I have to finish putting on my face THE DOORS OPEN on the empty shaft -- almost as an afterthought, PATIENCE/CATWOMAN snatches up her MASK, pul LONE to her with her other arm. THE CEILING gives way with a BURST OF FLAME --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENCE/CATWOMAN leaps into the open elevator shaft, LON has his arms around her -- together they slide down a CAB as FLAMES ERUPT from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL is now trapped in the make-up alcove, illuminated flames surrounding her, but she doesn't seem to care, wor frantically to get a new face on. She whispers a mantra:

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL
dialogues.text: You're still beautiful... you'll always be beautiful... CRASH! CHUNKS OF HELIPAD and the remains of the FLAMING CHOPPER come through the ceiling, obliterating Laurel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE charge into the building from a number of COP CARS As they do so, we see the ARMY OF CATS fleeing.  118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WESLEY, XAVIER and the MERCS are on the ground, SCRATCHED BLEEDING. They raise their hands for the puzzled, gun- wielding COPS.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Thank God you're here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN in this parking garage. PATIENCE/ CATWOMAN pulls LONE out, he seems woozy, his arms around neck. They collapse together against a wall. She tears the DUCT TAPE off Lone's mouth. He winces.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Who are you? PATIENCE/CATWOMAN hesitates, about to answer -- but inste gives him a long kiss. Then she darts OUT OF FRAME. LONE reels from the kiss, then collects himself and pulls duct tape from his eyes. WIDE SHOT -- he's alone, no sign of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD ANGLE as COPS hustle XAVIER and the OTHERS into police vehicles. CAMERA KEEPS PULLING UP, until we see th ruined ROOF of the building, IN FLAMES. The "A" in "AVENA BEAUTY" has been knocked out by the conflagration ... for few moments the sign reads "VENAL BEAUTY," until the whol thing EXPLODES and SPARKS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDNA lies on the couch, a hand over her eyes, asleep ina robe. She stirs as a TONGUE laps at her face. As she sits up, dozens of CATS are all over her, begging for attentio She laughs and cries at the same time then sees -- CATWOMAN, masked again, who has entered behind the cats.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Thank you. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: A promise is a promise. Her tone is soft, more like Patience's. EDNA takes in the blood on her, her torn clothes.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: I found out the truth. Edna notes the SUNLIGHT pouring through the window, eyes

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: But the sun is up... you're still Catwoman? CATWOMAN pulls off the mask and looks at it, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN / PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I'm Patience, too... with or without the mask. I don't think there's a difference any more.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Maybe there never really was. CATWOMAN/PATIENCE nods and smiles at this thoughtfully, accepting her dual nature at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with CARDBOARD BOXES. MOVING MEN carry a few out. SALLY is ostensibly lending a hand, but is mostly interes in the men's muscles. As she picks up a tiny box --

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You look awfully hot. Sure you don't wanna take that shirt off? SALLY winks at PATIENCE as she follows the man out the do Patience looks good, no trace of the old awkwardness -- s integrated her cat side. The PHONE RINGS, she snatches it in a swift, feline fashion. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: LONE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: (filter) Hi, Patience. Patience turns -- LONE stares from his window across the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Patience maintain eye contact while they speak.

dialogues.speaker: LONE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: (on phone) Moving out?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on phone) You are a good detective. It just feels like time for a change.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Where you heading?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Why? You still keeping tabs on me? Said on TV the Catwoman case was closed.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Mm. No hard feelings...?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Nah. In a way, it was flattering.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Funny thing, no one at the station remembers letting you out of jail.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: That's bureaucracy for you. (changing the subject) Hard to believe, Catwoman was Laurel Avenal all along.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. It is pretty hard to believe. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There's a significant pause, they eye each other across t alley. Lone knows, and Patience knows he knows. In unison

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE LONE
dialogues.text: Thank you -- Thank you -- They laugh at this, take a moment to recover. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: (a beat) Dinner the other night. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: For... teaching me some things. Listen, Patience - - if you're still interested -- I'd like to get to know you better. MIDNIGHT LEAPS UP onto Patience's shoulder, nuzzles her n

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Hey, you never really know anybody. Not completely.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I guess I had that coming... Look, I know it's not simple, I'm a cop and you're...

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: A dull accountant.

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is -- whatever you are, however... complicated -- I can deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Can you?

dialogues.speaker: LONE
dialogues.text: I'd like to try. I just don't want this to be good-bye. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATIENCE
dialogues.text: Oh... I have a feeling we'll see each other again. She HANGS UP, rolls her shoulders and lets out a little P WITH LONE, he smiles, putting the phone down himself as Patience moves away from the window. WITH PATIENCE, MOVE to find the CAT MASK as she places it top of stacks of slightly FIRE-DAMAGED $100 DOLLAR BILLS CLOSES THE SUITCASE. CuT TO BLACK.
